member.name: T:Vanara.Windows.Forms.ComCtl32v6Context
member.summary: Activation context that forces the loading of the v6 COMCTL32.DLL. This is not needed if the application has a manifest including COMCTL32 or if Application.RenderWithVisualStyles is set.

remarks.para: Use as follows for all items that require the 6.0 or later version of COMCTL32:

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ComboBoxExStyle
member.summary: Support the extended styles that are listed in this section as well as most standard combo box control styles.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ComboBoxExStyle.CBES_EX_NOEDITIMAGE
member.summary: The edit box and the dropdown list will not display item images.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ComboBoxExStyle.CBES_EX_NOEDITIMAGEINDENT
member.summary: The edit box and the dropdown list will not display item images.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ComboBoxExStyle.CBES_EX_PATHWORDBREAKPROC
member.summary: Windows NT only. The edit box will use the slash (/), backslash (\), and period (.) characters as word delimiters. This makes keyboard shortcuts for word-by-word cursor movement effective in path names and URLs.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ComboBoxExStyle.CBES_EX_NOSIZELIMIT
member.summary: Allows the ComboBoxEx control to be vertically sized smaller than its contained combo box control. If the ComboBoxEx is sized smaller than the combo box, the combo box will be clipped.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ComboBoxExStyle.CBES_EX_CASESENSITIVE
member.summary: BSTR searches in the list will be case sensitive. This includes searches as a result of text being typed in the edit box and the CB_FINDSTRINGEXACT message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ComboBoxExStyle.CBES_EX_TEXTENDELLIPSIS
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Causes items in the drop-down list and the edit box (when the edit box is read only) to be truncated with an ellipsis ("...") rather than just clipped by the edge of the control. This is useful when the control needs to be set to a fixed width, yet the entries in the list may be long.

member.summary: The NMHDR structure that contains information about the notification code.

member.summary: A value indicating whether the contents of the control's edit box have changed. This value is nonzero if the contents have been modified, or zero otherwise.

member.summary: The zero-based index of the item that will be selected after completing the edit operation. This value can be CB_ERR if no item will be selected.

member.summary: A zero-terminated string that contains the text from within the control's edit box.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMCOMBOBOXEX
member.summary: Contains information specific to ComboBoxEx items for use with notification codes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMCOMBOBOXEX.hdr
member.summary: The NMHDR structure that contains information about the notification code.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMCOMBOBOXEX.ceItem
member.summary: The COMBOBOXEXITEM structure that holds item information specific to the current notification. Upon receiving a notification code, the COMBOBOXEXITEM structure holds information required for the owner to respond. The members of this structure are often used as fields for the owner to return values in response to the notification.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.COMBOBOXEXITEM
member.summary: Contains information about an item in a ComboBoxEx control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.COMBOBOXEXITEM.mask
member.summary: A set of bit flags that specify attributes of this structure or of an operation that is using this structure. The flags specify members that are valid or must be filled in.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.COMBOBOXEXITEM.iItem
member.summary: The zero-based index of the item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.COMBOBOXEXITEM.pszText
member.summary: A pointer to a character buffer that contains or receives the item's text. If text information is being retrieved, this member must be set to the address of a character buffer that will receive the text. The size of this buffer must also be indicated in cchTextMax. If this member is set to LPSTR_TEXTCALLBACK, the control will request the information by using the CBEN_GETDISPINFO notification codes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.COMBOBOXEXITEM.cchTextMax
member.summary: The length of pszText, in TCHARs. If text information is being set, this member is ignored.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.COMBOBOXEXITEM.iImage
member.summary: The zero-based index of an image within the image list. The specified image will be displayed for the item when it is not selected. If this member is set to I_IMAGECALLBACK, the control will request the information by using CBEN_GETDISPINFO notification codes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.COMBOBOXEXITEM.iSelectedImage
member.summary: The zero-based index of an image within the image list. The specified image will be displayed for the item when it is selected. If this member is set to I_IMAGECALLBACK, the control will request the information by using CBEN_GETDISPINFO notification codes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.COMBOBOXEXITEM.iOverlay
member.summary: The one-based index of an overlay image within the image list. If this member is set to I_IMAGECALLBACK, the control will request the information by using CBEN_GETDISPINFO notification codes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.COMBOBOXEXITEM.iIndent
member.summary: The number of indent spaces to display for the item. Each indentation equals 10 pixels. If this member is set to I_INDENTCALLBACK, the control will request the information by using CBEN_GETDISPINFO notification codes.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.SUBCLASSPROC
member.summary: Defines the prototype for the callback function used by RemoveWindowSubclass and SetWindowSubclass.

param.name: hWnd
param.para: The handle to the subclassed window.

param.name: wParam
param.para: Additional message information. The contents of this parameter depend on the value of uMsg.

param.name: lParam
param.para: Additional message information. The contents of this parameter depend on the value of uMsg.

param.name: dwRefData
param.para: The reference data provided to the SetWindowSubclass function. This can be used to associate the subclass instance with a "this" pointer.

returns.para: Type: LRESULT
The return value is the result of the message processing and depends on the message sent.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification
member.summary: Notification codes for CommCtrl.h

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification.NM_OUTOFMEMORY
member.summary:
Notifies a control's parent window that the control could not complete an operation because there was not enough memory available. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
lParam A pointer to an NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification.NM_CLICK
member.summary: Sent by a control when the user clicks with the left mouse button. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification.NM_DBLCLK
member.summary: Sent by a control when the user double-clicks with the left mouse button. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification.NM_RETURN
member.summary:
Notifies a control's parent window that the control has the input focus and that the user has pressed the ENTER key. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
lParam A pointer to an NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification.NM_RCLICK
member.summary: Sent by a control when the user clicks with the right mouse button. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification.NM_RDBLCLK
member.summary: Sent by a control when the user double-clicks with the right mouse button. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification.NM_SETFOCUS
member.summary:
Notifies a control's parent window that the control has received the input focus. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
lParam A pointer to an NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification.NM_KILLFOCUS
member.summary:
Notifies a control's parent window that the control has lost the input focus. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
lParam A pointer to an NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification.NM_CUSTOMDRAW
member.summary:
Notifies a control's parent window about custom drawing operations. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
lParam
A pointer to a custom draw-related structure that contains information about the drawing operation. The following list specifies the controls and their associated structures.
Control Custom Draw Structure
Rebar, trackbar, and header NMCUSTOMDRAW
List view NMLVCUSTOMDRAW
Tooltip NMTTCUSTOMDRAW
Tree view NMTVCUSTOMDRAW
Toolbar NMTBCUSTOMDRAW
Return value
The value your application can return depends on the current drawing stage. The dwDrawStage member of the associated NMCUSTOMDRAW structure holds a value that specifies the drawing stage.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification.NM_HOVER
member.summary:
Sent by a control when the mouse hovers over an item. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
lParam A pointer to an NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.
Return value
Unless otherwise specified, return zero to allow the control to process the hover normally, or nonzero to prevent the hover from being processed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification.NM_NCHITTEST
member.summary:
Sent by a rebar control when the control receives a WM_NCHITTEST message. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
lParam
A pointer to a NMMOUSE structure that contains information about the notification code. The pt member contains the mouse coordinates of the hit test message.
Return value
Unless otherwise specified, return zero to allow the control to perform default processing of the hit test message, or return one of the HT* values documented under WM_NCHITTEST to override the default hit test processing.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification.NM_KEYDOWN
member.summary:
Sent by a control when the control has the keyboard focus and the user presses a key. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
lParam
A pointer to an NMKEY structure that contains additional information about the key that caused the notification code.
Return value Return nonzero to prevent the control from processing the key, or zero otherwise.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification.NM_RELEASEDCAPTURE
member.summary:
Notifies a control's parent window that the control is releasing mouse capture. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
lParam A pointer to an NMHDR structure that contains additional information about this notification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification.NM_SETCURSOR
member.summary:
Notifies a control's parent window that the control is setting the cursor in response to a WM_SETCURSOR message. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
lParam A pointer to an NMMOUSE structure that contains additional information about this notification.
Return value
Return zero to enable the control to set the cursor or nonzero to prevent the control from setting the cursor.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CommonControlNotification.NM_CHAR
member.summary:
The NM_CHAR notification code is sent by a control when a character key is processed. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
lParam
A pointer to an NMCHAR structure that contains additional information about the character that caused the notification code.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState
member.summary: The current item state.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_GRAYED
member.summary: The item is grayed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_DISABLED
member.summary: The item is disabled.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_CHECKED
member.summary: The item is in focus.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_FOCUS
member.summary: The item is in focus.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_DEFAULT
member.summary: The item is in its default state.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_HOT
member.summary: The item is currently under the pointer ("hot").

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_MARKED
member.summary: The item is marked. The meaning of this is determined by the implementation. This flag does not work correctly for owner-drawn list-view controls that have the LVS_SHOWSELALWAYS style. For these controls, you can determine whether an item is selected by using LVM_GETITEMSTATE (or ListView_GetItemState) and checking for the LVIS_SELECTED flag.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_INDETERMINATE

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_SHOWKEYBOARDCUES
member.summary: Version 6.0.The item is showing its keyboard cues. Comctl32 version 6 is not redistributable. operating systems. To use Comctl32.dll version 6, specify it in the manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_NEARHOT
member.summary: The item is part of a control that is currently under the mouse pointer ("hot"), but the item is not "hot" itself. The meaning of this is determined by the implementation.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_OTHERSIDEHOT
member.summary: The item is part of a splitbutton that is currently under the mouse pointer ("hot"), but the item is not "hot" itself. The meaning of this is determined by the implementation.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawItemState.CDIS_DROPHILITED
member.summary: The item is currently the drop target of a drag-and-drop operation.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse
member.summary: These constants are used as return values by a control in response to an NM_CUSTOMDRAW notification code.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse.CDRF_DODEFAULT
member.summary: The control will draw itself. It will not send any additional NM_CUSTOMDRAW notification codes for this paint cycle. This occurs when the dwDrawStage of the NMCUSTOMDRAW structure equals CDDS_PREPAINT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse.CDRF_NEWFONT
member.summary: The application specified a new font for the item; the control will use the new font. For more information about changing fonts, see Changing fonts and colors. This occurs when the dwDrawStage of the NMCUSTOMDRAW structure equals CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse.CDRF_SKIPDEFAULT
member.summary: The application drew the item manually. The control will not draw the item. This occurs when the dwDrawStage of the NMCUSTOMDRAW structure equals CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse.CDRF_DOERASE
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. The control will draw the background.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse.CDRF_NOTIFYPOSTPAINT
member.summary: The control will notify the parent after painting an item. This occurs when the dwDrawStage of the NMCUSTOMDRAW structure equals CDDS_PREPAINT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse.CDRF_NOTIFYITEMDRAW
member.summary: The control will notify the parent of any item-related drawing operations. It will send NM_CUSTOMDRAW notification codes before and after drawing items. This occurs when the dwDrawStage of the NMCUSTOMDRAW structure equals CDDS_PREPAINT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse.CDRF_NOTIFYSUBITEMDRAW
member.summary: Internet Explorer 4.0 and later. The control will notify the parent of any item-related drawing operations. It will send NM_CUSTOMDRAW notification codes before and after drawing items. This occurs when the dwDrawStage of the NMCUSTOMDRAW structure equals CDDS_PREPAINT. This flag is identical to CDRF_NOTIFYITEMDRAW and its use is context-dependent.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse.CDRF_NOTIFYPOSTERASE
member.summary: The control will notify the parent after erasing an item. This occurs when the dwDrawStage of the NMCUSTOMDRAW structure equals CDDS_PREPAINT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawResponse.CDRF_SKIPPOSTPAINT
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. The control will not draw the focus rectangle.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawStage.CDDS_POSTPAINT

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawStage.CDDS_PREERASE

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawStage.CDDS_POSTERASE

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawStage.CDDS_ITEM

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawStage.CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawStage.CDDS_ITEMPOSTPAINT

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CustomDrawStage.CDDS_ITEMPOSTERASE

member.summary: Flag combined with CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT or CDDS_ITEMPOSTPAINT if a subitem is being drawn. This will only be set if CDRF_NOTIFYITEMDRAW is returned from CDDS_PREPAINT.

param.name: uMsg
param.para: A value of type unsigned int that specifies a window message.

param.name: WPARAM
param.para: Specifies additional message information. The contents of this parameter depend on the value of the window message.

param.name: LPARAM

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.DrawShadowText(Vanara.PInvoke.HDC,System.String,System.UInt32,Vanara.PInvoke.RECT@,System.UInt32,Vanara.PInvoke.COLORREF,Vanara.PInvoke.COLORREF,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws text that has a shadow.

param.name: pszText

param.name: cch
param.para: A UINT that specifies the number of characters in the string that is to be drawn.

param.name: pRect
param.para: A pointer to a RECT structure that contains, in logical coordinates, the rectangle in which the text is to be drawn.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: A DWORD that specifies how the text is to be drawn. See Format Values for possible parameter values.

param.name: crText
param.para: A COLORREF structure that contains the color of the text.

param.name: crShadow
param.para: A COLORREF structure that contains the color of the text shadow.

returns.para: Type: int
Returns the height of the text in logical units if the function succeeds, otherwise returns zero.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.GetEffectiveClientRect(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND,Vanara.PInvoke.RECT@,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Calculates the dimensions of a rectangle in the client area that contains all the specified controls.

param.name: hWnd
param.para: A handle to the window that has the client area to check.

param.name: lprc
param.para: A pointer to a RECT structure that receives the dimensions of the rectangle.

param.name: lpInfo
param.para: A pointer to a null-terminated array of integers that identify controls in the client area. Each control requires a pair of consecutive elements. The first element of the pair must be nonzero and the second element of the pair must be the control identifier. The first pair represents the menu and is ignored. The last element must be zero to identify the end of the array.

member.returns: No return value.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.GetMUILanguage
member.summary: Gets the language currently in use by the common controls for a particular process.

returns.para: Type: LANGID

Returns the language identifier of the language an application has specified for the common controls by calling InitMUILanguage. GetMUILanguage returns the value for the process from which it is called. If InitMUILanguage has not been called or was not called from the same process, GetMUILanguage returns the language-neutral LANGID, MAKELANGID(LANG_NEUTRAL, SUBLANG_NEUTRAL).

param.name: uIdSubclass
param.para: UINT_PTR subclass ID. This ID and the callback pointer uniquely identify this subclass callback. Note: On 64-bit versions of Windows this is a 64-bit value.

param.name: pdwRefData
param.para: A pointer to a DWORD which will return the reference data. Note: On 64-bit versions of Windows, pointers are 64-bit values.

returns.para: Type: BOOL

item.term: The subclass callback was successfully installed.
The subclass callback was not installed.

param.name: pszName
param.para: A pointer to a null-terminated, Unicode buffer that contains location information about the icon to load. It is interpreted as follows:
If hinst is NULL, pszName can specify one of two things.
If hinst is non-null, pszName can specify one of two things.

param.name: lims
param.para: The desired metric. One of the following values:

item.term: Corresponds to SM_CXSMICON, the recommended pixel width of a small icon.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.LoadIconWithScaleDown(Vanara.PInvoke.HINSTANCE,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr@)
member.summary: Loads an icon. If the icon is not a standard size, this function scales down a larger image instead of scaling up a smaller image.

param.name: hinst
param.para: A handle to the module of either a DLL or executable (.exe) file that contains the icon to be loaded. For more information, see GetModuleHandle.
To load a predefined icon or a standalone icon file, set this parameter to NULL.

param.name: pszName
param.para: A pointer to a null-terminated, Unicode buffer that contains location information about the icon to load.
If hinst is non- NULL, pszName specifies the icon resource either by name or ordinal. This ordinal must be packaged by using the MAKEINTRESOURCE macro.

If hinst is NULL, pszName specifies either the name of a standalone icon (.ico) file or the identifier of a predefined icon to load. The following identifiers are recognized. To pass these constants to the LoadIconWithScaleDown function, use the MAKEINTRESOURCE macro. For example, to load the IDI_ERROR icon, pass as the pszName parameter and NULL as the hinst parameter.

param.name: cx
param.para: The desired width, in pixels, of the icon.

param.name: cy
param.para: The desired height, in pixels, of the icon.

param.name: phico
param.para: When this function returns, contains a pointer to the handle of the loaded icon.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns S_OK if successful, or an error value otherwise, including the following:

item.term: The contents of the buffer pointed to by pszName do not fit any of the expected interpretations.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.RemoveWindowSubclass(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND,Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.SUBCLASSPROC,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Removes a subclass callback from a window.

param.name: hWnd
param.para: The handle of the window being subclassed.

param.name: pfnSubclass
param.para: A pointer to a window procedure. This pointer and the subclass ID uniquely identify this subclass callback. For the callback function prototype, see SUBCLASSPROC.

param.name: uIdSubclass
param.para: The UINT_PTR subclass ID. This ID and the callback pointer uniquely identify this subclass callback. Note: On 64-bit versions of Windows this is a 64-bit value.

returns.para: Type: BOOL
TRUE if the subclass callback was successfully removed; otherwise, FALSE.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.SetWindowSubclass(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND,Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.SUBCLASSPROC,System.UInt32,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Installs or updates a window subclass callback.

param.name: hWnd
param.para: The handle of the window being subclassed.

param.name: pfnSubclass
param.para: A pointer to a window procedure. This pointer and the subclass ID uniquely identify this subclass callback. For the callback function prototype, see SUBCLASSPROC.

param.name: uIdSubclass
param.para: The subclass ID. This ID together with the subclass procedure uniquely identify a subclass. To remove a subclass, pass the subclass procedure and this value to the RemoveWindowSubclass function. This value is passed to the subclass procedure in the uIdSubclass parameter.

param.name: dwRefData
param.para: DWORD_PTR to reference data. The meaning of this value is determined by the calling application. This value is passed to the subclass procedure in the dwRefData parameter. A different dwRefData is associated with each combination of window handle, subclass procedure and uIdSubclass.

returns.para: Type: BOOL
TRUE if the subclass callback was successfully installed; otherwise, FALSE.

summary.para: [ ShowHideMenuCtl is available for use in the operating systems specified in the Requirements section. It may be altered or unavailable in subsequent versions.]

Sets or removes the specified menu item's check mark attribute and shows or hides the corresponding control. The function adds a check mark to the specified menu item if it does not have one and then displays the corresponding control. If the menu item already has a check mark, the function removes the check mark and hides the corresponding control.

param.name: hWnd
param.para: A handle to the window that contains the menu and controls.

param.name: uFlags
param.para: The identifier of the menu item to receive or lose a check mark.

param.name: lpInfo
param.para: A pointer to an array that contains pairs of values. The second value in the first pair must be the handle to the application's main menu. Each subsequent pair consists of a menu item identifier and a control window identifier. The function searches the array for a value that matches uFlags and, if the value is found, checks or unchecks the menu item and shows or hides the corresponding control.

returns.para: Type: BOOL
Returns nonzero if successful, or zero otherwise.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag
member.summary: The variable that receives information about the results of a hit test.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_ABOVE
member.summary: The point is above the header control's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_BELOW
member.summary: The point is below the header control's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_NOWHERE
member.summary: The point is inside the header control's bounding rectangle but is not over a header item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_ONDIVIDER
member.summary: The point is on the divider between two header items.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_ONDIVOPEN
member.summary: The point is on the divider of an item that has a width of zero. Dragging the divider reveals the item instead of resizing the item to the left of the divider.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_ONDROPDOWN
member.summary: The point is within the split button of the item. The style HDF_SPLITBUTTON must be set on the item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_ONFILTER
member.summary: The point is over the filter area.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_ONFILTERBUTTON
member.summary: The point is on the filter button.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_ONHEADER
member.summary: The point is to the left of the header control's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_ONITEMSTATEICON
member.summary: The point is within the state icon of the item. If style HDS_CHECKBOXES is specified, the point is within the checkbox of the item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_ONOVERFLOW
member.summary: The point is within the overflow button of the header control. The style HDS_OVERFLOW must be set on the header control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_TOLEFT
member.summary: The point is to the left of the header control's bounding rectangle.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderHitTestFlag.HHT_TORIGHT
member.summary: The point is to the right of the header control's bounding rectangle.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat
member.summary: Flags that specify an format.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_LEFT
member.summary: The item's contents are left-aligned.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_RIGHT
member.summary: The item's contents are right-aligned.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_CENTER
member.summary: The item's contents are centered.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_JUSTIFYMASK
member.summary: Isolate the bits corresponding to the three justification flags listed in the preceding table.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_RTLREADING
member.summary: Typically, windows displays text left-to-right (LTR). Windows can be mirrored to display languages such as Hebrew or Arabic that read right-to-left (RTL). Usually, header text is read in the same direction as the text in its parent window. If HDF_RTLREADING is set, header text will read in the opposite direction from the text in the parent window.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_CHECKBOX
member.summary: The item displays a checkbox. The flag is only valid when the HDS_CHECKBOXES style is first set on the header control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_CHECKED
member.summary: The item displays a checked checkbox. The flag is only valid when HDF_CHECKBOX is also set.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_FIXEDWIDTH
member.summary: The width of the item cannot be modified by a user action to resize it.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_OWNERDRAW
member.summary: The header control's owner draws the item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_STRING
member.summary: The item displays a string.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_BITMAP
member.summary: The item displays a bitmap.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_BITMAP_ON_RIGHT
member.summary: The bitmap appears to the right of text.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_IMAGE
member.summary: Display an image from an image list. Specify the image list by sending an HDM_SETIMAGELIST message. Specify the index of the image in the iImage member of this structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_SORTUP
member.summary: Draws an up-arrow on this item. This is typically used to indicate that information in the current window is sorted on this column in ascending order. This flag cannot be combined with HDF_IMAGE or HDF_BITMAP.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_SORTDOWN
member.summary: Draws a down-arrow on this item. This is typically used to indicate that information in the current window is sorted on this column in descending order. This flag cannot be combined with HDF_IMAGE or HDF_BITMAP.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemFormat.HDF_SPLITBUTTON
member.summary: The item displays a split button. The HDN_DROPDOWN notification is sent when the split button is clicked.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemMask
member.summary: Flags indicating which structure members contain valid data or must be filled in.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemMask.HDI_BITMAP
member.summary: The member is valid.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemMask.HDI_DI_SETITEM
member.summary: While handling the message HDM_GETITEM, the header control may not have all the values needed to complete the request. In this case, the control must call the application back for the values via the HDN_GETDISPINFO notification. If HDI_DI_SETITEM has been passed in the HDM_GETITEM message, the control will cache any values returned from HDN_GETDISPINFO (otherwise the values remain unset.)

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemMask.HDI_FILTER
member.summary: The and members are valid. This is used to filter out the values specified in the type member.

member.summary: The member is valid.

member.summary: The member is valid and specifies the image to be displayed with the item.

member.summary: The member is valid.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderItemMask.HDI_ORDER

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification
member.summary: Header control notifications

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_BEGINDRAG
member.summary: Sent by a header control when a drag operation has begun on one of its items. This notification code is sent only by header controls that are set to the HDS_DRAGDROP style. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
member.param: A pointer to an NMHEADER structure containing information about the header item that is being dragged.
member.returns: To allow the header control to automatically manage drag-and-drop operations, return FALSE. If the owner of the control is manually performing drag-and-drop reordering, return TRUE.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_BEGINFILTEREDIT
member.summary: Notifies a header control's parent window that a filter edit has begun. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
member.param: A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains additional information about the filter that is being edited.
member.returns: No return value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_BEGINTRACK
member.summary: Notifies a header control's parent window that the user has begun dragging a divider in the control (that is, the user has pressed the left mouse button while the mouse cursor is on a divider in the header control). This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
member.param: A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains information about the header control and the item whose divider is to be dragged.
member.returns: Returns FALSE to allow tracking of the divider, or TRUE to prevent tracking.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_DIVIDERDBLCLICK
member.summary: Notifies a header control's parent window that the user double-clicked the divider area of the control. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
member.param: A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains information about the header control and the item whose divider was double-clicked.
member.returns: No return value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_DROPDOWN
member.summary: Sent by a header control to its parent when the drop-down arrow on the header control is clicked. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
member.param: A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains information on the header control.
member.returns: No return value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_ENDDRAG
member.summary: Sent by a header control when a drag operation has ended on one of its items. This notification code is sent as a WM_NOTIFY message. Only header controls that are set to the HDS_DRAGDROP style send this notification code.
member.param: A pointer to an NMHEADER structure containing information about the header item that was being dragged.
member.returns: To allow the control to automatically place and reorder the item, return FALSE. To prevent the item from being placed, return TRUE.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_ENDFILTEREDIT
member.summary: Notifies a header control's parent window that a filter edit has ended. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
member.param: A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains additional information about the filter that is being edited.
member.returns: No return value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_ENDTRACK
member.summary: Notifies a header control's parent window that the user has finished dragging a divider. This notification code sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
member.param: A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains information about the header control and the item whose divider was dragged.
member.returns: No return value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_FILTERBTNCLICK
member.summary: Notifies the header control's parent window when the filter button is clicked or in response to an HDM_SETITEM message. This notification code sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
member.param: A pointer to an NMHDFILTERBTNCLICK structure that contains information about the header control and the header filter button.
member.returns: If you return TRUE, an HDN_FILTERCHANGE notification code will be sent to the header control's parent window. This notification code gives the parent window an opportunity to synchronize its user interface elements. Return FALSE if you do not want the notification sent.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_FILTERCHANGE
member.summary: Notifies the header control's parent window that the attributes of a header control filter are being changed or edited. This notification code sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
member.param: A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains information about the header control and the header item, including the attributes that are about to change.
member.returns: No return value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_GETDISPINFO
member.summary: Sent to the owner of a header control when the control needs information about a callback header item. This notification code is sent as a WM_NOTIFY message.
member.param: A pointer to an NMHDDISPINFO structure. On input, the fields of the structure specify what information is required and the item of interest.
member.returns: Returns an LRESULT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_ITEMCHANGED
member.summary: Notifies a header control's parent window that the attributes of a header item have changed. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
member.param: A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains information about the header control, including the attributes that have changed.
member.returns: No return value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_ITEMCHANGING
member.summary: Notifies a header control's parent window that the attributes of a header item are about to change. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
member.param: A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains information about the header control and the header item, including the attributes that are about to change.
member.returns: Returns FALSE to allow the changes, or TRUE to prevent them.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_ITEMCLICK
member.summary: Notifies a header control's parent window that the user clicked the control. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
member.param: A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that identifies the header control and specifies the index of the header item that was clicked and the mouse button used to click the item. The pItem member is set to NULL.
member.returns: No return value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_ITEMDBLCLICK
member.summary: Notifies a header control's parent window that the user double-clicked the control. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message. Only header controls that are set to the HDS_BUTTONS style send this notification code.
member.param: A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains information about this notification code.
member.returns: No return value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_ITEMKEYDOWN
member.summary: Notifies a header control's parent window that a key has been pressed with an item selected. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
member.param: A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains additional information about the key that is being pressed.
member.returns: No return value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_ITEMSTATEICONCLICK
member.summary: Notifies a header control's parent window that the user clicked an item's state icon. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
member.param: A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains additional information about the state icon that was clicked on.
member.returns: No return value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_OVERFLOWCLICK
member.summary: Sent by a header control to its parent when the header's overflow button is clicked. This notification code is sent in the form of an WM_NOTIFY message.

param.name: lParam
param.para: A pointer to a NMHEADER structure that describes the notification code. The calling process is responsible for allocating this structure, including the contained NMHDR structure. Set the members of the NMHDR structure, including the code member that must be set to HDN_OVERFLOWCLICK.
Set the iItem member of the NMHEADER structure to the index of the first header item that is not visible and thus should be displayed on an overflow.

member.returns: No return value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderNotification.HDN_TRACK
member.summary: Notifies a header control's parent window that the user is dragging a divider in the header control. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
member.param: A pointer to an NMHEADER structure that contains information about the header control and the item whose divider is being dragged.
member.returns: Returns FALSE to continue tracking the divider, or TRUE to end tracking.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle
member.summary: Header controls have a number of styles, described in this section, that determine the control's appearance and behavior. You set the initial styles when you create the header control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_BUTTONS
member.summary: Each item in the control looks and behaves like a push button. This style is useful if an application carries out a task when the user clicks an item in the header control. For example, an application could sort information in the columns differently depending on which item the user clicks.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_DRAGDROP
member.summary: Allows drag-and-drop reordering of header items.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_FILTERBAR
member.summary: Include a filter bar as part of the standard header control. This bar allows users to conveniently apply a filter to the display. Calls to HDM_LAYOUT will yield a new size for the control and cause the list view to update.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_FLAT
member.summary: Version 6.0 and later. Causes the header control to be drawn flat when the operating system is running in classic mode. Comctl32.dll version 6 is not redistributable but it is included in Windows. To use Comctl32.dll version 6, specify it in a manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_FULLDRAG
member.summary: Causes the header control to display column contents even while the user resizes a column.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_HIDDEN
member.summary: Indicates a header control that is intended to be hidden. This style does not hide the control. Instead, when you send the HDM_LAYOUT message to a header control with the HDS_HIDDEN style, the control returns zero in the cy member of the WINDOWPOS structure. You would then hide the control by setting its height to zero. This can be useful when you want to use the control as an information container instead of a visual control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_HORZ
member.summary: Creates a header control with a horizontal orientation.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_HOTTRACK
member.summary: Enables hot tracking.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_CHECKBOXES
member.summary: Version 6.00 and later. Allows the placing of checkboxes on header items. For more information, see the fmt member of HDITEM.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_NOSIZING
member.summary: Version 6.00 and later. The user cannot drag the divider on the header control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HeaderStyle.HDS_OVERFLOW
member.summary: Version 6.00 and later. A button is displayed when not all items can be displayed within the header control's rectangle. When clicked, this button sends an HDN_OVERFLOWCLICK notification.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDTEXTFILTER
member.summary: Contains information about header control text filters.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDTEXTFILTER.pszText
member.summary: A pointer to the buffer containing the filter.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDTEXTFILTER.cchTextMax
member.summary: A value specifying the maximum size, in characters, for an edit control buffer.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDTEXTFILTER.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: The filter.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDTEXTFILTER.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: The length.

member.returns: A that represents this instance.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDHITTESTINFO
member.summary: Contains information about a hit test. This structure is used with the HDM_HITTEST message and it supersedes the HD_HITTESTINFO structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDHITTESTINFO.pt
member.summary: A POINT structure that contains the point to be hit test, in client coordinates.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDHITTESTINFO.flags
member.summary: The variable that receives information about the results of a hit test. Two of these values can be combined, such as when the position is above and to the left of the client area.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDHITTESTINFO.iItem
member.summary: If the hit test is successful, contains the index of the item at the hit test point.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDITEM
member.summary: Contains information about an item in a header control. This structure supersedes the HD_ITEM structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDITEM.mask
member.summary: Flags indicating which other structure members contain valid data or must be filled in.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDITEM.cxy
member.summary: The width or height of the item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDITEM.pszText
member.summary: A pointer to an item string. If the text is being retrieved from the control, this member must be initialized to point to a character buffer. If this member is set to LPSTR_TEXTCALLBACK, the control will request text information for this item by sending an HDN_GETDISPINFO notification code. Note that although the header control allows a string of any length to be stored as item text, only the first 260 TCHARs are displayed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDITEM.hbm
member.summary: A handle to the item bitmap.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.HDITEM.cchTextMax

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMHEADER.pItem
member.summary: An optional pointer to an HDITEM structure containing information about the item specified by iItem. The mask member of the HDITEM structure indicates which of its members are valid.

summary.para: The set of bit flags that specifies the type of image list to create. This parameter can be a combination of the following values, but it can include only one of the ILC_COLOR values. Used by ImageList_Create and IImageList2::Initialize.

item.term: Use a mask. The image list contains two bitmaps, one of which is a monochrome bitmap used as a mask. If this value is not included, the image list contains only one bitmap.
Use the default behavior if none of the other ILC_COLORx flags is specified. Typically, the default is ILC_COLOR4, but for older display drivers, the default is ILC_COLORDDB.
Use a 4-bit (16-color) device-independent bitmap (DIB) section as the bitmap for the image list.
Use an 8-bit DIB section. The colors used for the color table are the same colors as the halftone palette.
Mirror the icons contained, if the process is mirrored
Causes the mirroring code to mirror each item when inserting a set of images, versus the whole strip.
Windows Vista and later. Imagelist should accept smaller than set images and apply original size based on image added.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ILC.ILC_MASK
member.summary: Use a mask. The image list contains two bitmaps, one of which is a monochrome bitmap used as a mask. If this value is not included, the image list contains only one bitmap.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ILC.ILC_COLOR
member.summary: Use the default behavior if none of the other ILC_COLORx flags is specified. Typically, the default is ILC_COLOR4, but for older display drivers, the default is ILC_COLORDDB.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ILC.ILC_COLORDDB
member.summary: Use a device-dependent bitmap.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ILC.ILC_COLOR4
member.summary: Use a 4-bit (16-color) device-independent bitmap (DIB) section as the bitmap for the image list.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ILC.ILC_COLOR8
member.summary: Use an 8-bit DIB section. The colors used for the color table are the same colors as the halftone palette.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ILC.ILC_COLOR16
member.summary: Use a 16-bit (32/64k-color) DIB section.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ILC.ILC_COLOR24
member.summary: Use a 24-bit DIB section.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ILC.ILC_COLOR32
member.summary: Use a 32-bit DIB section.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ILC.ILC_PALETTE
member.summary: Not implemented.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ILC.ILC_MIRROR
member.summary: Mirror the icons contained, if the process is mirrored

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ILC.ILC_PERITEMMIRROR
member.summary: Causes the mirroring code to mirror each item when inserting a set of images, versus the whole strip.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ILC.ILC_ORIGINALSIZE
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Imagelist should accept smaller than set images and apply original size based on image added.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ILC.ILC_HIGHQUALITYSCALE
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Reserved.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTCOPYFLAG
member.summary: Flags used when copying image lists.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTCOPYFLAG.ILCF_MOVE
member.summary: The source image is copied to the destination image's index. This operation results in multiple instances of a given image.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTCOPYFLAG.ILCF_SWAP
member.summary: The source and destination images exchange positions within the image list.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWFLAGS
member.summary: Passed to the IImageList::Draw method in the fStyle member of IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWFLAGS.ILD_NORMAL
member.summary: Draws the image using the background color for the image list. If the background color is the CLR_NONE value, the image is drawn transparently using the mask.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWFLAGS.ILD_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: Draws the image transparently using the mask, regardless of the background color. This value has no effect if the image list does not contain a mask.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWFLAGS.ILD_BLEND25
member.summary: Draws the image, blending 25 percent with the blend color specified by rgbFg. This value has no effect if the image list does not contain a mask.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWFLAGS.ILD_FOCUS
member.summary: Same as ILD_BLEND25

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWFLAGS.ILD_BLEND50
member.summary: Draws the image, blending 50 percent with the blend color specified by rgbFg. This value has no effect if the image list does not contain a mask.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWFLAGS.ILD_SELECTED
member.summary: Same as ILD_BLEND50

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWFLAGS.ILD_BLEND
member.summary: Same as ILD_BLEND50

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWFLAGS.ILD_MASK
member.summary: Draws the mask.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWFLAGS.ILD_IMAGE
member.summary: If the overlay does not require a mask to be drawn, set this flag.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWFLAGS.ILD_ROP
member.summary: Draws the image using the raster operation code specified by the dwRop member.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWFLAGS.ILD_OVERLAYMASK
member.summary: To extract the overlay image from the fStyle member, use the logical AND to combine fStyle with the ILD_OVERLAYMASK value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWFLAGS.ILD_PRESERVEALPHA
member.summary: Preserves the alpha channel in the destination.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWFLAGS.ILD_SCALE
member.summary: Causes the image to be scaled to cx, cy instead of being clipped.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWFLAGS.ILD_DPISCALE
member.summary: Scales the image to the current dpi of the display.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWFLAGS.ILD_ASYNC
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Draw the image if it is available in the cache. Do not extract it automatically. The called draw method returns E_PENDING to the calling component, which should then take an alternative action, such as, provide another image and queue a background task to force the image to be loaded via ForceImagePresent using the ILFIP_ALWAYS flag. The ILD_ASYNC flag then prevents the extraction operation from blocking the current thread and is especially important if a draw method is called from the user interface (UI) thread.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTITEMFLAG
member.summary: Item flags.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTITEMFLAG.ILIF_ALPHA
member.summary: Indicates that the item in the imagelist has an alpha channel.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTITEMFLAG.ILIF_LOWQUALITY
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Indicates that the item in the imagelist was generated via a StretchBlt function, consequently image quality may have degraded.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTSTATEFLAGS
member.summary: The following flags are passed to the IImageList::Draw method in the fState member of IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTSTATEFLAGS.ILS_NORMAL
member.summary: The image state is not modified.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTSTATEFLAGS.ILS_GLOW
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTSTATEFLAGS.ILS_SHADOW
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTSTATEFLAGS.ILS_SATURATE
member.summary: Reduces the color saturation of the icon to grayscale. This only affects 32bpp images.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTSTATEFLAGS.ILS_ALPHA
member.summary: Alpha blends the icon. Alpha blending controls the transparency level of an icon, according to the value of its alpha channel. The value of the alpha channel is indicated by the frame member in the IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS method. The alpha channel can be from 0 to 255, with 0 being completely transparent, and 255 being completely opaque.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IImageList
member.summary: Exposes methods that manipulate and interact with image lists.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IImageList.Add(Vanara.PInvoke.HBITMAP,Vanara.PInvoke.HBITMAP)
member.summary: Adds an image or images to an image list.
member.param: A handle to the bitmap that contains the image or images. The number of images is inferred from the width of the bitmap.
A handle to the bitmap that contains the mask. If no mask is used with the image list, this parameter is ignored.
member.returns: When this method returns, contains a pointer to the index of the first new image. If the method fails to successfully add the new image, this value is -1.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IImageList.ReplaceIcon(System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.HICON)
member.summary: Replaces an image with an icon or cursor.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the index of the image to replace. If i is -1, the function adds the image to the end of the list.
A handle to the icon or cursor that contains the bitmap and mask for the new image.
member.returns: A pointer to an int that will contain the index of the image on return if successful, or -1 otherwise.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IImageList.SetOverlayImage(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a specified image to the list of images used as overlay masks. An image list can have up to four overlay masks in Common Controls version 4.70 and earlier, and up to 15 in version 4.71 or later. The method assigns an overlay mask index to the specified image.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the zero-based index of an image in the image list. This index identifies the image to use as an overlay mask.
A value of type int that contains the one-based index of the overlay mask.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IImageList.Replace(System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.HBITMAP,Vanara.PInvoke.HBITMAP)
member.summary: Replaces an image in an image list with a new image.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the index of the image to replace.
A handle to the bitmap that contains the image.
A handle to the bitmap that contains the mask. If no mask is used with the image list, this parameter is ignored.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IImageList.AddMasked(Vanara.PInvoke.HBITMAP,Vanara.PInvoke.COLORREF)
member.summary: Adds an image or images to an image list, generating a mask from the specified bitmap.
member.param: A handle to the bitmap that contains one or more images. The number of images is inferred from the width of the bitmap.
The color used to generate the mask. Each pixel of this color in the specified bitmap is changed to black, and the corresponding bit in the mask is set to 1.
member.returns: A pointer to an int that contains the index of the first new image when it returns, if successful, or -1 otherwise.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IImageList.Draw(Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS)
member.summary: Draws an image list item in the specified device context.
member.param: A pointer to an IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS structure that contains the drawing parameters.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IImageList.Remove(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes an image from an image list.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the index of the image to remove. If this parameter is -1, the method removes all images.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IImageList.GetIcon(System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWFLAGS)
member.summary: Creates an icon from an image and a mask in an image list.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the index of the image.
A combination of flags that specify the drawing style. For a list of values, see IImageList::Draw.
member.returns: A pointer to an int that contains the handle to the icon if successful, or NULL if otherwise.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IImageList.GetImageInfo(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets information about an image.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the index of the image.
member.returns: A pointer to an IMAGEINFO structure that receives information about the image. The information in this structure can directly manipulate the bitmaps of the image.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IImageList.Copy(System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IImageList,System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTCOPYFLAG)
member.summary: Copies images from a given image list.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the zero-based index of the destination image for the copy operation.
A pointer to the IUnknown interface for the source image list.
A value of type int that contains the zero-based index of the source image for the copy operation.
A value that specifies the type of copy operation to be made.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IImageList.Merge(System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IImageList,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Guid@)
member.summary: Creates a new image by combining two existing images. This method also creates a new image list in which to store the image.
member.param: A value of type int that contains the index of the first existing image.
A pointer to the IUnknown interface of the image list that contains the second image.
A value of type int that contains the index of the second existing image.
A value of type int that contains the x-component of the offset of the second image relative to the first image.
A value of type int that contains the y-component of the offset of the second image relative to the first image.

member.summary: Creates an image list from the specified bitmap.

param.name: hi
param.para: A handle to the instance that contains the resource. This parameter can be NULL if you are loading an image from a file or loading an OEM resource.

param.name: lpbmp
param.para: If the uFlags parameter includes LR_LOADFROMFILE, lpbmp is the address of a null-terminated string that names the file containing the image to load.
If the hi parameter is non- NULL and LR_LOADFROMFILE is not specified, lpbmp is the address of a null-terminated string that contains the name of the image resource in the hi module.

If hi is NULL and LR_LOADFROMFILE is not specified, the LOWORD of this parameter must be the identifier of an OEM image to load. To create this value, use the MAKEINTRESOURCE macro with one of the OEM image identifiers defined in Winuser.h. These identifiers have the following prefixes.

param.name: cx
param.para: The width of each image. The height of each image and the initial number of images are inferred by the dimensions of the specified resource.

param.name: cGrow
param.para: The number of images by which the image list can grow when the system needs to make room for new images. This parameter represents the number of new images that the resized image list can contain.

param.name: crMask
param.para: The color used to generate a mask. Each pixel of this color in the specified bitmap, cursor, or icon is changed to black, and the corresponding bit in the mask is set to 1. If this parameter is the CLR_NONE value, no mask is generated. If this parameter is the CLR_DEFAULT value, the color of the pixel at the upper-left corner of the image is treated as the mask color.

param.name: uType
param.para: A flag that specifies the type of image to load. This parameter must be IMAGE_BITMAP to indicate that a bitmap is being loaded.

param.name: uFlags
param.para: Flags that specify how to load the image. This parameter can be a combination of the following values.

item.term: Causes the function to return a DIB section bitmap rather than a compatible bitmap when the uType parameter specifies IMAGE_BITMAP. LR_CREATEDIBSECTION is useful for loading a bitmap without mapping it to the colors of the display device.
Uses the color format of the display.

Uses the width or height specified by the system metric values for cursors and icons if the cx parameter is set to zero. If this value is not specified and cx is set to zero, the function sets the size to the one specified in the resource. If the resource contains multiple images, the function sets the size to that of the first image.
Loads the image from the file specified by the lpbmp parameter.

Searches the color table for the image and replaces the following shades of gray with the corresponding three-dimensional color: Dk Gray: RGB(128, 128, 128)COLOR_3DSHADOW Gray: RGB(192, 192, 192)COLOR_3DFACE Lt Gray: RGB(223, 223, 223)COLOR_3DLIGHT For more information, see the Remarks section.

Retrieves the color value of the first pixel in the image and replaces the corresponding entry in the color table with the default window color (the COLOR_WINDOW display color). All pixels in the image that use that color become the default window value color. This value applies only to images that have a corresponding color table. For more information, see the Remarks section.
Loads the image in black and white.

Shares the image handle if the image is loaded multiple times. Do not use this value for images that have nontraditional sizes that might change after loading or for images that are loaded from a file.

returns.para: Type: HIMAGELIST
Returns the handle to the image list if successful, or NULL otherwise.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ImageList_Read(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IStream)
member.summary: Reads an image list from a stream.

returns.para: Type: HIMAGELIST
Returns the handle to the image list if successful, or NULL otherwise.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ImageList_ReadEx(Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ILP,System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IStream,System.Guid@,System.Object@)

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: A flag that specifies how the stream is read.

item.term: Expects an image list that was written with the ILP_NORMAL flag specified.
Expects an image list that was written with the ILP_DOWNLEVEL flag specified.

param.name: riid
param.para: An IID for the image list.

param.name: ppv
param.para: The address of a pointer to the interface for the image list if successful, NULL otherwise.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

Returns nonzero if successful, or zero otherwise.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ImageList_WriteEx(Vanara.PInvoke.HIMAGELIST,Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ILP,System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IStream)
member.summary: Writes an image list to a stream.

param.name: himl
param.para: A handle to the image list.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: A flag that specifies how the stream is written.

item.term: Writes to the stream using the file format for Common Controls 6.0, which includes information about image list attributes new to this version.
Writes to the stream using a file format previous to version 6.0. Specify this flag if you need to save image lists loaded under Common Controls versions earlier than version 6.0.

If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.summary: A value that specifies the number of pixels to draw, relative to the upper-left corner of the drawing operation as specified by xBitmap and yBitmap. If cx and cy are zero, then Draw draws the entire valid section. The method does not ensure that the parameters are valid.

member.summary: The y-coordinate that specifies the upper-left corner of the drawing operation in reference to the image itself. Pixels of the image that are to the left of xBitmap and above yBitmap do not appear.

member.summary: The image background color. This parameter can be an application-defined RGB value or or .

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.rgbFg
member.summary: The image foreground color. This member is used only if fStyle includes the ILD_BLEND25 or ILD_BLEND50 flag. This parameter can be an application-defined RGB value or or .

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.dwRop
member.summary: A value specifying a raster operation code. These codes define how the color data for the source rectangle will be combined with the color data for the destination rectangle to achieve the final color. This member is ignored if fStyle does not include the ILD_ROP flag.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.fState
member.summary: A flag that specifies the drawing state. This member can contain one or more image list state flags. You must use comctl32.dll version 6 to use this member.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.Frame
member.summary:
Used with the alpha blending effect.
When used with ILS_ALPHA, this member holds the value for the alpha channel. This value can be from 0 to 255, with 0 being completely transparent, and 255 being completely opaque.
You must use comctl32.dll version 6 to use this member. See the Remarks.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS.crEffect

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.WC_IPADDRESS
member.summary: Creates IP address controls. These controls are similar to an edit control, but they enable you to enter a numeric address in Internet protocol (IP) format.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IPAddressMessage
member.summary: IP Address Messages

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IPAddressMessage.IPM_CLEARADDRESS
member.summary: Clears the contents of the IP address control.
member.param: Must be zero.
Must be zero.
member.returns: The return value is not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IPAddressMessage.IPM_SETADDRESS
member.summary: Sets the address values for all four fields in the IP address control.
member.param: Must be zero.

A DWORD value that contains the new address. The field 3 value is contained in bits 0 through 7. The field 2 value is contained in bits 8 through 15. The field 1 value is contained in bits 16 through 23. The field 0 value is contained in bits 24 through 31. The MAKEIPADDRESS macro can also be used to create the address information.
member.returns: The return value is not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IPAddressMessage.IPM_GETADDRESS
member.summary: Gets the address values for all four fields in the IP address control.
member.param: Must be zero.

A pointer to a DWORD value that receives the address. The field 3 value will be contained in bits 0 through 7. The field 2 value will be contained in bits 8 through 15. The field 1 value will be contained in bits 16 through 23. The field 0 value will be contained in bits 24 through 31. The FIRST_IPADDRESS, SECOND_IPADDRESS, THIRD_IPADDRESS, and FOURTH_IPADDRESS macros can also be used to extract the address information. Zero will be returned as the address for any blank fields.
member.returns: Returns the number of nonblank fields.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IPAddressMessage.IPM_SETRANGE
member.summary: ets the valid range for the specified field in the IP address control.
member.remarks: If the user enters a value in the field that is outside of this range, the control will send the IPN_FIELDCHANGED notification with the entered value. If the value is still outside of the range after sending the notification, the control will attempt to change the entered value to the closest range limit.
member.param: A zero-based field index to which the range will be applied.

A WORD value that contains the lower limit of the range in the low-order byte and the upper limit in the high-order byte. Both of these values are inclusive. The MAKEIPRANGE macro can also be used to create the range.
member.returns: Returns nonzero if successful, or zero otherwise.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IPAddressMessage.IPM_SETFOCUS
member.summary: Sets the keyboard focus to the specified field in the IP address control. All of the text in that field will be selected.
member.param: A zero-based field index to which the focus should be set. If this value is greater than the number of fields, focus is set to the first blank field. If all fields are nonblank, focus is set to the first field.
Must be zero.
member.returns: The return value is not used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IPAddressMessage.IPM_ISBLANK
member.summary: Determines if all fields in the IP address control are blank.
member.param: Must be zero.
Must be zero.
member.returns: Returns nonzero if all fields are blank, or zero otherwise.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IPAddressNotification
member.summary: IP Address Notifications

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.IPAddressNotification.IPN_FIELDCHANGED
member.summary: Sent when the user changes a field in the control or moves from one field to another. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
member.param: A pointer to an NMIPADDRESS structure that contains information about the changed address. The iValue member of this structure will contain the entered value, even if it is out of the range of the field. You can modify this member to any value that is within the range for the field in response to this notification code.
member.returns: The return value is ignored.

member.summary: Gets the IP address represented as a byte array from an unsigned pointer.
member.param: The IP address.
member.returns: The IP address represented as a byte array.

The field 1 address.
The field 2 address.
The field 3 address.
member.returns: Returns an LPARAM value that contains the address.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.MAKEIPADDRESS(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Packs four byte-values into a single LPARAM suitable for use with the IPM_SETADDRESS message.
member.param: The bytes ordered 0-3.
member.returns: Returns an LPARAM value that contains the address.

The upper limit of the range.
member.returns: Returns an LPARAM value that contains the range.

member.summary: An NMHDR structure that contains additional information about the notification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMIPADDRESS.iField

member.summary: The new value of the field specified in the iField member. While processing the IPN_FIELDCHANGED notification, this member can be set to any value that is within the range of the field and the control will place this new value in the field.

member.summary: Flags for the member.

member.summary: The list-view control has no background image.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ListViewBkImageFlag.LVBKIF_SOURCE_HBITMAP
member.summary: A background bitmap is supplied via the hbm member of LVBKIMAGE. If the message LVM_SETBKIMAGE succeeds, then the list-view takes ownership of the bitmap.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ListViewBkImageFlag.LVBKIF_SOURCE_URL
member.summary: The pszImage member contains the URL of the background image.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ListViewBkImageFlag.LVBKIF_SOURCE_MASK
member.summary: You can use the LVBKIF_SOURCE_MASK value to mask off all but the source flags.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ListViewBkImageFlag.LVBKIF_STYLE_NORMAL
member.summary: The background image is displayed normally.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ListViewBkImageFlag.LVBKIF_STYLE_TILE
member.summary: The background image will be tiled to fill the entire background of the control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ListViewBkImageFlag.LVBKIF_STYLE_MASK
member.summary: You can use the LVBKIF_STYLE_MASK value to mask off all but the style flags.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ListViewBkImageFlag.LVBKIF_FLAG_TILEOFFSET
member.summary: Specify the coordinates of the first tile. This flag is valid only if the LVBKIF_STYLE_TILE flag is also specified. If this flag is not specified, the first tile begins at the upper-left corner of the client area. If you use ComCtl32.dll Version 6.0 the xOffsetPercent and yOffsetPercent fields contain pixels, not percentage values, to specify the coordinates of the first tile. Comctl32.dll version 6 is not redistributable but it is included in Windows or later. Also, you must specify Comctl32.dll version 6 in a manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ListViewBkImageFlag.LVBKIF_TYPE_WATERMARK
member.summary: A watermark background bitmap is supplied via the hbm member of LVBKIMAGE. If the LVM_SETBKIMAGE message succeeds, then the list-view control takes ownership of the bitmap.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ListViewBkImageFlag.LVBKIF_FLAG_ALPHABLEND
member.summary: Valid only when LVBKIF_TYPE_WATERMARK is also specified. This flag indicates the bitmap provided via LVBKIF_TYPE_WATERMARK contains a valid alpha channel.
