member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TaskDialogNotification
member.summary: Task Dialog callback notifications.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TaskDialogNotification.TDN_CREATED
member.summary: Sent by the task dialog after the dialog has been created and before it is displayed. This notification code is received only through the task dialog callback function, which can be registered using the TaskDialogIndirect method.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TaskDialogNotification.TDN_NAVIGATED
member.summary: Sent by a task dialog when navigation has occurred. This notification code is received only through the task dialog callback function, which can be registered using the TaskDialogIndirect method.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TaskDialogNotification.TDN_BUTTON_CLICKED
member.summary: Sent by a task dialog when the user selects a button or command link in the task dialog. This notification code is received only through the task dialog callback function, which can be registered using the TaskDialogIndirect method. To prevent the task dialog from closing, the application must return S_FALSE, otherwise the task dialog is closed and the button ID is returned via the original application call.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TaskDialogNotification.TDN_HYPERLINK_CLICKED
member.summary: Sent by a task dialog when the user clicks a hyperlink in the task dialog content. This notification code is received only through the task dialog callback function, which can be registered using the TaskDialogIndirect method.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TaskDialogNotification.TDN_TIMER
member.summary: Sent by a task dialog approximately every 200 milliseconds. This notification code is sent when the TDF_CALLBACK_TIMER flag has been set in the dwFlags member of the TASKDIALOGCONFIG structure that was passed to the TaskDialogIndirect function. This notification code is received only through the task dialog callback function, which can be registered using the TaskDialogIndirect method.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TaskDialogNotification.TDN_DESTROYED
member.summary: Sent by a task dialog when it is destroyed and its window handle is no longer valid. This notification code is received only through the task dialog callback function, which can be registered using the TaskDialogIndirect method.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TaskDialogNotification.TDN_RADIO_BUTTON_CLICKED
member.summary: Sent by a task dialog when the user selects a radio button or command link in the task dialog. This notification code is received only through the task dialog callback function, which can be registered using the TaskDialogIndirect method.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TaskDialogNotification.TDN_DIALOG_CONSTRUCTED
member.summary: Sent by a task dialog after the dialog has been created and before it is displayed. This notification code is received only through the task dialog callback function, which can be registered using the TaskDialogIndirect method.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TaskDialogNotification.TDN_VERIFICATION_CLICKED
member.summary: Sent by a task dialog when the user clicks the task dialog verification check box. This notification code is received only through the task dialog callback function, which can be registered using the TaskDialogIndirect method.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TaskDialogNotification.TDN_HELP
member.summary: Sent by a task dialog when the user presses F1 on the keyboard while the dialog has focus. This notification code is received only through the task dialog callback function, which can be registered using the TaskDialogIndirect method.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TaskDialogNotification.TDN_EXPANDO_BUTTON_CLICKED
member.summary: Sent by the task dialog when the user clicks on the dialog's expando button. This notification is received only through the task dialog callback function, which can be registered using the TaskDialogIndirect method.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TaskDialog(Vanara.PInvoke.HWND,Vanara.PInvoke.HINSTANCE,System.String,System.String,System.String,Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOG_COMMON_BUTTON_FLAGS,Vanara.PInvoke.SafeResourceId,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The TaskDialog function creates, displays, and operates a task dialog. The task dialog contains application-defined message text and title, icons, and any combination of predefined push buttons. This function does not support the registration of a callback function to receive notifications.
member.param: Handle to the owner window of the task dialog to be created. If this parameter is NULL, the task dialog has no owner window.

Handle to the module that contains the icon resource identified by the pszIcon member, and the string resources identified by the pszWindowTitle and pszMainInstruction members. If this parameter is NULL, pszIcon must be NULL or a pointer to a null-terminated, Unicode string that contains a system resource identifier, for example, TD_ERROR_ICON.

Pointer to the string to be used for the task dialog title. This parameter is a null-terminated, Unicode string that contains either text, or an integer resource identifier passed through the MAKEINTRESOURCE macro. If this parameter is NULL, the filename of the executable program is used.

Pointer to the string to be used for the main instruction. This parameter is a null-terminated, Unicode string that contains either text, or an integer resource identifier passed through the MAKEINTRESOURCE macro. This parameter can be NULL if no main instruction is wanted.

Pointer to a string used for additional text that appears below the main instruction, in a smaller font. This parameter is a null-terminated, Unicode string that contains either text, or an integer resource identifier passed through the MAKEINTRESOURCE macro. Can be NULL if no additional text is wanted.
Specifies the push buttons displayed in the dialog box. This parameter may be a combination of flags from the following group.

Pointer to a string that identifies the icon to display in the task dialog. This parameter must be an integer resource identifier passed to the MAKEINTRESOURCE macro or one of the following predefined values. If this parameter is NULL, no icon will be displayed. If the hInstance parameter is NULL and one of the predefined values is not used, the TaskDialog function fails.
When this function returns, contains a pointer to an integer location that receives one of the standard button result values.
member.returns:
This function can return one of these values.
Return code Description
S_OK The operation completed successfully.
E_OUTOFMEMORY There is insufficient memory to complete the operation.
E_INVALIDARG One or more arguments are not valid.
E_FAIL The operation failed.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TaskDialogIndirect(Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: The TaskDialogIndirect function creates, displays, and operates a task dialog. The task dialog contains application-defined icons, messages, title, verification check box, command links, push buttons, and radio buttons. This function can register a callback function to receive notification messages.
member.param: Pointer to a TASKDIALOGCONFIG structure that contains information used to display the task dialog.
Address of a variable that receives one of the button IDs specified in the pButtons member of the pTaskConfig parameter or a standard button ID value.
Address of a variable that receives one of the button IDs specified in the pRadioButtons member of the pTaskConfig parameter. If this parameter is NULL, no value is returned.
Address of a variable that receives a value indicating if the verification checkbox was checked when the dialog was dismissed.
member.returns:
This function can return one of these values.
Return code Description
S_OK The operation completed successfully.
E_OUTOFMEMORY There is insufficient memory to complete the operation.
E_INVALIDARG One or more arguments are not valid.
E_FAIL The operation failed.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOG_BUTTON
member.summary: The TASKDIALOG_BUTTON structure contains information used to display a button in a task dialog. The TASKDIALOGCONFIG structure uses this structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOG_BUTTON.nButtonID
member.summary: Indicates the value to be returned when this button is selected.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOG_BUTTON.pszButtonText
member.summary: Pointer that references the string to be used to label the button. This parameter can be either a null-terminated string or an integer resource identifier passed to the MAKEINTRESOURCE macro. When using Command Links, you delineate the command from the note by placing a new line character in the string.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG
member.summary: The TASKDIALOGCONFIG structure contains information used to display a task dialog. The TaskDialogIndirect function uses this structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.cbSize
member.summary: Specifies the structure size, in bytes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.hwndParent
member.summary: Handle to the parent window. This member can be NULL.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.hInstance
member.summary: Handle to the module that contains the icon resource identified by the pszMainIcon or pszFooterIcon members, and the string resources identified by the pszWindowTitle, pszMainInstruction, pszContent, pszVerificationText, pszExpandedInformation, pszExpandedControlText, pszCollapsedControlText or pszFooter members.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.dwFlags
member.summary: Specifies the behavior of the task dialog. This parameter can be a combination of flags.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.dwCommonButtons
member.summary: Specifies the push buttons displayed in the task dialog. If no common buttons are specified and no custom buttons are specified using the cButtons and pButtons members, the task dialog will contain the OK button by default. This parameter may be a combination of flags.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.pszWindowTitle
member.summary: Pointer that references the string to be used for the task dialog title. This parameter can be either a null-terminated string or an integer resource identifier passed to the MAKEINTRESOURCE macro. If this parameter is NULL, the filename of the executable program is used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.mainIcon
member.summary:
A handle to an Icon that is to be displayed in the task dialog. This member is ignored unless the TDF_USE_HICON_MAIN flag is specified. If this member is NULL and the TDF_USE_HICON_MAIN is specified, no icon will be displayed.
OR
Pointer that references the icon to be displayed in the task dialog. This parameter is ignored if the USE_HICON_MAIN flag is specified. Otherwise, if this parameter is NULL or the hInstance parameter is NULL, no icon will be displayed. This parameter must be an integer resource identifier passed to the MAKEINTRESOURCE macro.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.pszMainInstruction
member.summary: Pointer that references the string to be used for the main instruction. This parameter can be either a null-terminated string or an integer resource identifier passed to the MAKEINTRESOURCE macro.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.pszContent
member.summary: Pointer that references the string to be used for the dialog's primary content. This parameter can be either a null-terminated string or an integer resource identifier passed to the MAKEINTRESOURCE macro. If the ENABLE_HYPERLINKS flag is specified for the dwFlags member, then this string may contain hyperlinks in the form: Hyperlink Text. WARNING: Enabling hyperlinks when using content from an unsafe source may cause security vulnerabilities.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.cButtons
member.summary: The number of entries in the pButtons array that is used to create buttons or command links in the task dialog. If this member is zero and no common buttons have been specified using the dwCommonButtons member, then the task dialog will have a single OK button displayed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.pButtons
member.summary: Pointer to an array of TASKDIALOG_BUTTON structures containing the definition of the custom buttons that are to be displayed in the task dialog. This array must contain at least the number of entries that are specified by the cButtons member.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.nDefaultButton
member.summary: The default button for the task dialog. This may be any of the values specified in nButtonID members of one of the TASKDIALOG_BUTTON structures in the pButtons array, or one of the IDs corresponding to the buttons specified in the dwCommonButtons member. If this member is zero or its value does not correspond to any button ID in the dialog, then the first button in the dialog will be the default.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.cRadioButtons

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.pRadioButtons

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.nDefaultRadioButton
member.summary: The button ID of the radio button that is selected by default. If this value does not correspond to a button ID, the first button in the array is selected by default.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.pszVerificationText
member.summary: Pointer that references the string to be used to label the verification checkbox. This parameter can be either a null-terminated string or an integer resource identifier passed to the MAKEINTRESOURCE macro. If this parameter is NULL, the verification checkbox is not displayed in the task dialog. If the pfVerificationFlagChecked parameter of TaskDialogIndirect is NULL, the checkbox is not enabled.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.pszExpandedInformation
member.summary: Pointer that references the string to be used for displaying additional information. This parameter can be either a null-terminated string or an integer resource identifier passed to the MAKEINTRESOURCE macro. The additional information is displayed either immediately below the content or below the footer text depending on whether the TDF_EXPAND_FOOTER_AREA flag is specified. If the TDF_ENABLE_HYPERLINKS flag is specified for the dwFlags member, then this string may contain hyperlinks in the form: Hyperlink Text. member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TASKDIALOGCONFIG.pszCollapsedControlText

OR

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBCDRF
member.summary: The value your application can return depends on the current drawing stage. The dwDrawStage member of the associated NMCUSTOMDRAW structure holds a value that specifies the drawing stage. You must return one of the following values.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBCDRF.TBCDRF_NOEDGES
member.summary: Version 4.71. Do not draw button edges. This occurs when dwDrawStage equals CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBCDRF.TBCDRF_HILITEHOTTRACK
member.summary: Version 4.71. Use the clrHighlightHotTrack member of the NMTBCUSTOMDRAW structure to draw the background of hot-tracked items. This occurs when dwDrawStage equals CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBCDRF.TBCDRF_NOOFFSET
member.summary: Version 4.71. Do not offset the button when pressed. This occurs when dwDrawStage equals CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBCDRF.TBCDRF_NOMARK
member.summary: Do not draw default highlight of items that have the TBSTATE_MARKED. This occurs when dwDrawStage equals CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBCDRF.TBCDRF_NOETCHEDEFFECT
member.summary: Version 4.71. Do not draw etched effect for disabled items. This occurs when dwDrawStage equals CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBCDRF.TBCDRF_BLENDICON
member.summary: Version 5.00. Blend the button 50 percent with the background. This occurs when dwDrawStage equals CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBCDRF.TBCDRF_NOBACKGROUND
member.summary: Version 5.00. Do not draw button background. This occurs when dwDrawStage equals CDDS_ITEMPREPAINT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBCDRF.TBCDRF_USECDCOLORS
member.summary: Version 6.00, Windows Vista only. Use custom draw colors to render text regardless of visual style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBSTATE.TBSTATE_CHECKED
member.summary: The button has the TBSTYLE_CHECK style and is being clicked.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBSTATE.TBSTATE_ELLIPSES
member.summary: Version 4.70. The button's text is cut off and an ellipsis is displayed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBSTATE.TBSTATE_ENABLED
member.summary: The button accepts user input. A button that does not have this state is grayed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBSTATE.TBSTATE_HIDDEN
member.summary: The button is not visible and cannot receive user input.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBSTATE.TBSTATE_INDETERMINATE
member.summary: The button is grayed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBSTATE.TBSTATE_MARKED
member.summary: Version 4.71. The button is marked. The interpretation of a marked item is dependent upon the application.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBSTATE.TBSTATE_PRESSED
member.summary: The button is being clicked.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBSTATE.TBSTATE_WRAP
member.summary: The button is followed by a line break. The button must also have the TBSTATE_ENABLED state.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyle.TBSTYLE_ALTDRAG
member.summary: Allows users to change a toolbar button's position by dragging it while holding down the ALT key. If this style is not specified, the user must hold down the SHIFT key while dragging a button. Note that the CCS_ADJUSTABLE style must be specified to enable toolbar buttons to be dragged.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyle.TBSTYLE_AUTOSIZE
member.summary: Equivalent to BTNS_AUTOSIZE. Use TBSTYLE_AUTOSIZE for version 4.72 and earlier.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyle.TBSTYLE_BUTTON
member.summary: Equivalent to BTNS_BUTTON. Use TBSTYLE_BUTTON for version 4.72 and earlier.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyle.TBSTYLE_CHECK
member.summary: Equivalent to BTNS_CHECK. Use TBSTYLE_CHECK for version 4.72 and earlier.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyle.TBSTYLE_CHECKGROUP
member.summary: Equivalent to BTNS_CHECKGROUP. Use TBSTYLE_CHECKGROUP for version 4.72 and earlier.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyle.TBSTYLE_CUSTOMERASE
member.summary: Version 4.70. Generates NM_CUSTOMDRAW notification codes when the toolbar processes WM_ERASEBKGND messages.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyle.TBSTYLE_DROPDOWN
member.summary: Equivalent to BTNS_DROPDOWN. Use TBSTYLE_DROPDOWN for version 4.72 and earlier.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyle.TBSTYLE_FLAT
member.summary: Version 4.70. Creates a flat toolbar. In a flat toolbar, both the toolbar and the buttons are transparent and hot-tracking is enabled. Button text appears under button bitmaps. To prevent repainting problems, this style should be set before the toolbar control becomes visible.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyle.TBSTYLE_GROUP
member.summary: Equivalent to BTNS_GROUP. Use TBSTYLE_GROUP for version 4.72 and earlier.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyle.TBSTYLE_LIST
member.summary: Version 4.70. Creates a flat toolbar with button text to the right of the bitmap. Otherwise, this style is identical to TBSTYLE_FLAT. To prevent repainting problems, this style should be set before the toolbar control becomes visible.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyle.TBSTYLE_NOPREFIX
member.summary: Equivalent to BTNS_NOPREFIX. Use TBSTYLE_NOPREFIX for version 4.72 and earlier.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyle.TBSTYLE_REGISTERDROP
member.summary: Version 4.71. Generates TBN_GETOBJECT notification codes to request drop target objects when the cursor passes over toolbar buttons.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyle.TBSTYLE_SEP
member.summary: Equivalent to BTNS_SEP. Use TBSTYLE_SEP for version 4.72 and earlier.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyle.TBSTYLE_TOOLTIPS
member.summary: Creates a tooltip control that an application can use to display descriptive text for the buttons in the toolbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyle.TBSTYLE_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: Version 4.71. Creates a transparent toolbar. In a transparent toolbar, the toolbar is transparent but the buttons are not. Button text appears under button bitmaps. To prevent repainting problems, this style should be set before the toolbar control becomes visible.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyle.TBSTYLE_WRAPABLE
member.summary: Creates a toolbar that can have multiple lines of buttons. Toolbar buttons can "wrap" to the next line when the toolbar becomes too narrow to include all buttons on the same line. When the toolbar is wrapped, the break will occur on either the rightmost separator or the rightmost button if there are no separators on the bar. This style must be set to display a vertical toolbar control when the toolbar is part of a vertical rebar control. This style cannot be combined with CCS_VERT.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyleEx
member.summary: This section lists the extended styles supported by toolbar controls.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyleEx.TBSTYLE_EX_DRAWDDARROWS
member.summary: Version 4.71. This style allows buttons to have a separate dropdown arrow. Buttons that have the BTNS_DROPDOWN style will be drawn with a dropdown arrow in a separate section, to the right of the button. If the arrow is clicked, only the arrow portion of the button will depress, and the toolbar control will send a TBN_DROPDOWN notification code to prompt the application to display the dropdown menu. If the main part of the button is clicked, the toolbar control sends a WM_COMMAND message with the button's ID. The application normally responds by launching the first command on the menu. There are many situations where you may want to have only some of the dropdown buttons on a toolbar with separated arrows. To do so, set the TBSTYLE_EX_DRAWDDARROWS extended style. Give those buttons that will not have separated arrows the BTNS_WHOLEDROPDOWN style. Buttons with this style will have an arrow displayed next to the image. However, the arrow will not be separate and when any part of the button is clicked, the toolbar control will send a TBN_DROPDOWN notification code. To prevent repainting problems, this style should be set before the toolbar control becomes visible.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyleEx.TBSTYLE_EX_MIXEDBUTTONS
member.summary: Version 5.81. This style allows you to set text for all buttons, but only display it for those buttons with the BTNS_SHOWTEXT button style. The TBSTYLE_LIST style must also be set. Normally, when a button does not display text, your application must handle TBN_GETINFOTIP or TTN_GETDISPINFO to display a tooltip. With the TBSTYLE_EX_MIXEDBUTTONS extended style, text that is set but not displayed on a button will automatically be used as the button's tooltip text. Your application only needs to handle TBN_GETINFOTIP or or TTN_GETDISPINFO if it needs more flexibility in specifying the tooltip text.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyleEx.TBSTYLE_EX_HIDECLIPPEDBUTTONS
member.summary: Version 5.81. This style hides partially clipped buttons. The most common use of this style is for toolbars that are part of a rebar control. If an adjacent band covers part of a button, the button will not be displayed. However, if the rebar band has the RBBS_USECHEVRON style, the button will be displayed on the chevron's dropdown menu.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyleEx.TBSTYLE_EX_MULTICOLUMN
member.summary: Version 5.82. Intended for internal use; not recommended for use in applications. This style gives the toolbar a vertical orientation and organizes the toolbar buttons into columns. The buttons flow down vertically until a button has exceeded the bounding height of the toolbar (see TB_SETBOUNDINGSIZE), and then a new column is created. The toolbar flows the buttons in this manner until all buttons are positioned. To use this style, the TBSTYLE_EX_VERTICAL style must also be set.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyleEx.TBSTYLE_EX_VERTICAL
member.summary: Version 5.82. Intended for internal use; not recommended for use in applications. This style gives the toolbar a vertical orientation. Toolbar buttons flow from top to bottom instead of horizontally.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolbarStyleEx.TBSTYLE_EX_DOUBLEBUFFER
member.summary: Version 6. This style requires the toolbar to be double buffered. Double buffering is a mechanism that detects when the toolbar has changed.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CreateMappedBitmap(Vanara.PInvoke.HINSTANCE,Vanara.PInvoke.SafeResourceId,Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CMB,Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.COLORMAP@,System.Int32)

param.name: idBitmap

param.name: wFlags

item.term: Uses a bitmap as a mask.

param.name: lpColorMap
param.para: Pointer to a COLORMAP structure that contains the color information needed to map the bitmaps. If this parameter is NULL, the function uses the default color map.

param.name: iNumMaps

returns.para: Type: HBITMAP
Returns the handle to the bitmap if successful, or NULL otherwise. To retrieve extended error information, call GetLastError.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTBDISPINFO
member.summary: Contains and receives display information for a toolbar item. This structure is used with the TBN_GETDISPINFO notification code.

summary.para: Type: NMHDR
NMHDR structure that contains additional information about the notification.
Type: DWORD
Set of flags that indicate which members of this structure are being requested. This can be one or more of the following values.

item.term: The item's image index is being requested. The image index must be placed in the iImage member.
Set this flag when processing TBN_GETDISPINFO; the toolbar control will retain the supplied information and not request it again.

summary.para: Type: int
Command identifier of the item for which display information is being requested. This member is filled in by the control before it sends the notification code.
Type: DWORD_PTR
Application-defined value associated with the item for which display information is being requested. This member is filled in by the control before sending the notification code.
Type: int
Image index for the item.
Type: LPTSTR
Pointer to a character buffer that receives the item's text.
Type: int
Size of the pszText buffer, in characters.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTBGETINFOTIP
member.summary: Contains and receives infotip information for a toolbar item. This structure is used with the TBN_GETINFOTIP notification code.

summary.para: Type: NMHDR
NMHDR structure that contains additional information about the notification.
Type: LPTSTR
Address of a character buffer that receives the infotip text.
Type: int

Size of the buffer, in characters, at pszText. In most cases, the buffer will be INFOTIPSIZE characters in size, but you should always make sure that your application does not copy more than cchTextMax characters to the buffer at pszText.
Type: int
The command identifier of the item for which infotip information is being requested. This member is filled in by the control before sending the notification code.
Type: LPARAM
The application-defined value associated with the item for which infotip information is being requested. This member is filled in by the control before sending the notification code.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTBHOTITEM
member.summary: Contains information used with the TBN_HOTITEMCHANGE notification code.

summary.para: Type: NMHDR
NMHDR structure that contains additional information about the notification.
Type: int
Command identifier of the previously highlighted item.
Type: int
Command identifier of the item about to be highlighted.
Type: DWORD
Flags that indicate why the hot item has changed. This can be one or more of the following values:

item.term: The change in the hot item was caused by a shortcut key.
The change in the hot item was caused by an arrow key.
Modifies HICF_ACCELERATOR. If this flag is set, more than one item has the same shortcut key character.
Modifies the other reason flags. If this flag is set, there is no previous hot item and idOld does not contain valid information.
Modifies the other reason flags. If this flag is set, there is no new hot item and idNew does not contain valid information.
The change in the hot item resulted from a left-click mouse event.
The change in the hot item resulted from a mouse event.
The change in the hot item resulted from an event that could not be determined. This will most often be due to a change in focus or the TB_SETHOTITEM message.
The change in the hot item resulted from the user entering the shortcut key for an item that was already hot.
Version 5.80. Causes the button to switch states.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTBRESTORE
member.summary: Allows applications to extract the information that was placed in NMTBSAVE when the toolbar state was saved. This structure is passed to applications when they receive a TBN_RESTORE notification code.

summary.para: Type: NMHDR
NMHDR structure that contains additional information about the notification.
Type: DWORD*

Pointer to the data stream with the stored save information. It contains Shell-defined blocks of information for each button, alternating with application-defined blocks. Applications may also place a block of global data at the start of pData. The format and length of the application-defined blocks are determined by the application.
Type: DWORD*

Pointer to the current block of application-defined data. After extracting the data, the application must advance pCurrent to the end of the block, so it is pointing to the next block of Shell-defined data.
Type: UINT
Size of pData.
Type: int

Value of -1 indicates that the restore is starting, and pCurrent will point to the start of the data stream. Otherwise, it is the zero-based button index, and pCurrent will point to the current button's data.
Type: int
Estimate of the number of buttons. Because the estimate is based on the size of the data stream, it might be incorrect. The client should update it as appropriate.
Type: int

Number of bytes needed to hold the data for each button. When the restore starts, cbBytesPerRecord will be set to the size of the Shell-defined data structure. You need to increment it by the size of the structure that holds the application-defined data.
Type: TBBUTTON
TBBUTTON structure that contains information about the button currently being restored. Applications must modify this structure as necessary before returning.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTBSAVE
member.summary: This structure is passed to applications when they receive a TBN_SAVE notification code. It contains information about the button currently being saved. Applications can modify the values of the members to save additional information.

summary.para: Type: NMHDR
An NMHDR structure that contains additional information about the notification.
Type: DWORD*

A pointer to the data stream used to store the save information. When complete, it will contain blocks of Shell-defined information for each button, alternating with blocks defined by the application. Applications may also choose to place a block of global data at the start of pData. The format and length of the application-defined blocks are determined by the application. When the save starts, the Shell will pass the amount of memory it needs in cbData, but no memory will be allocated. You must allocate enough memory for pData to hold your data, plus the Shell's.
Type: DWORD*

A pointer to the start of the unused portion of the data stream. You should load your data here, and then advance pCurrent to the start of the remaining unused portion. The Shell will then load the information for the next button, advance pCurrent, and so on.
Type: UINT
The size of the data stream. When the save starts, cbData will be set to the amount of data needed by the Shell. You should change it to the total amount allocated.
Type: int
This parameter is usually the zero-based index of the button currently being saved. It is set to -1 to indicate that a save is starting.
Type: int
An estimate of the number of buttons. Because it is based on the size of the data stream, it may be incorrect. The client should update it as appropriate.
Type: TBBUTTON
A TBBUTTON structure that contains information about the button currently being saved.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTOOLBAR
member.summary: Contains information used to process toolbar notification codes. This structure supersedes the TBNOTIFY structure.

summary.para: Type: NMHDR
NMHDR structure that contains additional information about the notification.
Type: int
Command identifier of the button associated with the notification code.
Type: TBBUTTON

TBBUTTON structure that contains information about the toolbar button associated with the notification code. This member only contains valid information with the TBN_QUERYINSERT and TBN_QUERYDELETE notification codes.
Type: int
Count of characters in the button text.
Type: LPTSTR
Address of a character buffer that contains the button text.
Type: RECT
Version 5.80. A RECT structure that defines the area covered by the button.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBADDBITMAP
member.summary: Adds a bitmap that contains button images to a toolbar.

summary.para: Type: HINSTANCE
Handle to the module instance with the executable file that contains a bitmap resource. To use bitmap handles instead of resource IDs, set this member to NULL.
You can add the system-defined button bitmaps to the list by specifying HINST_COMMCTRL as the hInst member and one of the following values as the nID member.

item.term: Windows Explorer travel buttons and favorites bitmaps in normal state.
Windows Explorer travel buttons and favorites bitmaps in hot state.
Windows Explorer travel buttons and favorites bitmaps in disabled state.
Windows Explorer travel buttons and favorites bitmaps in pressed state.

summary.para: Type: UINT_PTR
If hInst is NULL, set this member to the bitmap handle of the bitmap with the button images. Otherwise, set it to the resource identifier of the bitmap with the button images.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBBUTTON
member.summary: Contains information about a button in a toolbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBBUTTON.iBitmap
member.summary:
Zero-based index of the button image. Set this member to I_IMAGECALLBACK, and the toolbar will send the TBN_GETDISPINFO notification code to retrieve the image index when it is needed.
Version 5.81. Set this member to I_IMAGENONE to indicate that the button does not have an image.The button layout will not include any space for a bitmap, only text.
If the button is a separator, that is, if fsStyle is set to BTNS_SEP, iBitmap determines the width of the separator, in pixels.For information on selecting button images from image lists, see TB_SETIMAGELIST message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBBUTTON.idCommand
member.summary: Command identifier associated with the button. This identifier is used in a WM_COMMAND message when the button is chosen.

member.name: P:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBBUTTON.fsState
member.summary: Button state flags.

member.name: P:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBBUTTON.fsStyle
member.summary: Button style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBBUTTON.dwData
member.summary: Application-defined value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBBUTTON.iString
member.summary: Zero-based index of the button string, or a pointer to a string buffer that contains text for the button.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBBUTTONINFO
member.summary: Contains or receives information for a specific button in a toolbar.

summary.para: Type: UINT
Size of the structure, in bytes. This member must be filled in prior to sending the associated message.
Type: DWORD
Set of flags that indicate which members contain valid information. This member must be filled in prior to sending the associated message. This can be one or more of the following values.

item.term: Version 5.80. The wParam sent with a TB_GETBUTTONINFO or TB_SETBUTTONINFO message is an index, not an identifier.
The idCommand member contains valid information or is being requested.
The iImage member contains valid information or is being requested.
The lParam member contains valid information or is being requested.
The cx member contains valid information or is being requested.
The fsState member contains valid information or is being requested.
The fsStyle member contains valid information or is being requested.
The pszText member contains valid information or is being requested.

summary.para: Type: int
Command identifier of the button.
Type: int
Image index of the button. Set this member to I_IMAGECALLBACK, and the toolbar will send the TBN_GETDISPINFO notification code to retrieve the image index when it is needed.
Version 5.81. Set this member to I_IMAGENONE to indicate that the button does not have an image. The button layout will not include any space for a bitmap, only text.
Type: BYTE
State flags of the button. This can be one or more of the values listed in Toolbar Button States.
Type: BYTE
Style flags of the button. This can be one or more of the values listed in Toolbar Control and Button Styles.
Type: WORD
Width of the button, in pixels.
Type: DWORD_PTR
Application-defined value associated with the button.
Type: LPTSTR
Address of a character buffer that contains or receives the button text.
Type: int
Size of the buffer at pszText. If the button information is being set, this member is ignored.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBINSERTMARK
member.summary: Contains information on the insertion mark in a toolbar control.

summary.para: Type: int
Zero-based index of the insertion mark. If this member is -1, there is no insertion mark.
Type: DWORD
Defines where the insertion mark is in relation to iButton. This can be one of the following values:

item.term: The insertion mark is to the left of the specified button.
The insertion mark is to the right of the specified button.
The insertion mark is on the background of the toolbar. This flag is only used with the TB_INSERTMARKHITTEST message.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBMETRICS
member.summary: Defines the metrics of a toolbar that are used to shrink or expand toolbar items.

summary.para: Type: UINT
Size of the TBMETRICS structure.
Type: DWORD
Mask that determines the metric to retrieve. It can be any combination of the following:

item.term: Retrieve the cxPad and cyPad values.
Retrieve the cxBarPad and cyBarPad values.
Retrieve the cxButtonSpacing and cyButtonSpacing values.

summary.para: Type: int
Width of the padding inside the toolbar buttons, between the content and the edge of the button.
Type: int
Height of the padding inside the toolbar buttons, between the content and the edge of the button.
Type: int
Width of the toolbar. Not used.
Type: int
Height of the toolbar. Not used.
Type: int
Width of the space between toolbar buttons.
Type: int
Height of the space between toolbar buttons.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TBREPLACEBITMAP
member.summary: Used with the TB_REPLACEBITMAP message to replace one toolbar bitmap with another.

summary.para: Type: HINSTANCE
Module instance handle to the bitmap resource being replaced. Set this member to NULL to instead use a bitmap handle.
Type: UINT_PTR
If hInstOld is NULL, set this member to the bitmap handle of the bitmap that is being replaced. Otherwise, set it to the resource identifier of the bitmap being replaced.
Type: HINSTANCE
Module instance handle that contains the new bitmap resource. Set this member to NULL to instead use a bitmap handle.
Type: UINT_PTR
If hInstNew is NULL, set this member to the bitmap handle of the bitmap with the new button images. Otherwise, set it to the resource identifier of the bitmap with the new button images.
Type: int
Number of button images contained in the new bitmap. The number of new images should be the same as the number of replaced images.

Value name.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolTipInfoFlags
member.summary: Flags that control the tooltip display.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolTipInfoFlags.TTF_IDISHWND
member.summary: Indicates that the uId member is the window handle to the tool. If this flag is not set, uId is the tool's identifier.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolTipInfoFlags.TTF_CENTERTIP
member.summary: Centers the tooltip window below the tool specified by the uId member.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolTipInfoFlags.TTF_RTLREADING
member.summary: Indicates that the tooltip text will be displayed in the opposite direction to the text in the parent window.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolTipInfoFlags.TTF_SUBCLASS
member.summary: Indicates that the tooltip control should subclass the tool's window to intercept messages, such as WM_MOUSEMOVE. If this flag is not set, you must use the TTM_RELAYEVENT message to forward messages to the tooltip control. For a list of messages that a tooltip control processes, see TTM_RELAYEVENT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolTipInfoFlags.TTF_TRACK
member.summary: Positions the tooltip window next to the tool to which it corresponds and moves the window according to coordinates supplied by the TTM_TRACKPOSITION messages. You must activate this type of tool using the TTM_TRACKACTIVATE message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolTipInfoFlags.TTF_ABSOLUTE
member.summary: Positions the tooltip window at the same coordinates provided by TTM_TRACKPOSITION. This flag must be used with the TTF_TRACK flag.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolTipInfoFlags.TTF_TRANSPARENT
member.summary: Causes the tooltip control to forward mouse event messages to the parent window. This is limited to mouse events that occur within the bounds of the tooltip window.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolTipInfoFlags.TTF_PARSELINKS
member.summary:
Version 6.0 and later. Indicates that links in the tooltip text should be parsed.
Note that Comctl32.dll version 6 is not redistributable but it is included in Windows or later. To use Comctl32.dll version 6, specify it in a manifest. For more information on manifests, see Enabling Visual Styles.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolTipInfoFlags.TTF_DI_SETITEM
member.summary: The TTF di setitem

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolTipNotification.TTN_GETDISPINFO
member.summary: Sent by a tooltip control to retrieve information needed to display a tooltip window. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolTipNotification.TTN_SHOW
member.summary: Notifies the owner window that a tooltip control is about to be displayed. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolTipNotification.TTN_POP
member.summary: Notifies the owner window that a tooltip is about to be hidden. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolTipNotification.TTN_LINKCLICK
member.summary: Sent when a text link inside a balloon tooltip is clicked. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.ToolTipNotification.TTN_NEEDTEXT
member.summary: Sent by a tooltip control to retrieve information needed to display a tooltip window. This notification code is identical to TTN_GETDISPINFO. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTTDISPINFO
member.summary: Contains information used in handling the TTN_GETDISPINFO notification code. This structure supersedes the TOOLTIPTEXT structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTTDISPINFO.hdr
member.summary: NMHDR structure that contains additional information about the notification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTTDISPINFO.lpszText
member.summary: Pointer to a null-terminated string that will be displayed as the tooltip text. If hinst specifies an instance handle, this member must be the identifier of a string resource.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTTDISPINFO.szText
member.summary: Buffer that receives the tooltip text. An application can copy the text to this buffer instead of specifying a string address or string resource. For tooltip text that exceeds 80 TCHARs, see comments in the remarks section of this document.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTTDISPINFO.hinst
member.summary: Handle to the instance that contains a string resource to be used as the tooltip text. If lpszText is the address of the tooltip text string, this member must be NULL.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTTDISPINFO.uFlags
member.summary:
Flags that indicates how to interpret the idFrom member of the included NMHDR structure.
Value Meaning
TTF_IDISHWND If this flag is set, idFrom is the tool's handle. Otherwise, it is the tool's identifier.
TTF_RTLREADING
Windows can be mirrored to display languages such as Hebrew or Arabic that read right-to-left (RTL). Normally, tooltip text is read in same direction as the text in its parent window. To have a tooltip read in the opposite direction from its parent window, add the TTF_RTLREADING flag to the uFlags member when processing the notification.
TTF_DI_SETITEM
Version 4.70. If you add this flag to uFlags while processing the notification, the tooltip control will retain the supplied information and not request it again.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTTDISPINFO.lParam
member.summary: Version 4.70. Application-defined data associated with the tool.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TOOLINFO
member.summary: The TOOLINFO structure contains information about a tool in a tooltip control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TOOLINFO.cbSize
member.summary: Size of this structure, in bytes. This member must be specified.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TOOLINFO.uFlags
member.summary: Flags that control the tooltip display. This member can be a combination of the following values:

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TOOLINFO.hwnd
member.summary: Handle to the window that contains the tool. If lpszText includes the LPSTR_TEXTCALLBACK value, this member identifies the window that receives the TTN_GETDISPINFO notification codes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TOOLINFO.uId
member.summary: Application-defined identifier of the tool. If uFlags includes the TTF_IDISHWND flag, uId must specify the window handle to the tool.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TOOLINFO.rect
member.summary: The bounding rectangle coordinates of the tool. The coordinates are relative to the upper-left corner of the client area of the window identified by hwnd. If uFlags includes the TTF_IDISHWND flag, this member is ignored.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TOOLINFO.hinst
member.summary: Handle to the instance that contains the string resource for the tool. If lpszText specifies the identifier of a string resource, this member is used.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TOOLINFO.lpszText
member.summary: Pointer to the buffer that contains the text for the tool, or identifier of the string resource that contains the text. This member is sometimes used to return values. If you need to examine the returned value, must point to a valid buffer of sufficient size. Otherwise, it can be set to NULL. If lpszText is set to LPSTR_TEXTCALLBACK, the control sends the TTN_GETDISPINFO notification code to the owner window to retrieve the text.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TOOLINFO.lParam
member.summary: Version 4.70 and later. A 32-bit application-defined value that is associated with the tool.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TOOLINFO.lpReserved
member.summary: Reserved. Must be set to NULL.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TTGETTITLE.cch
member.summary: UINT that specifies the number of characters in the title.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TTGETTITLE.pszTitle

member.summary: Contains information that a tooltip control uses to determine whether a point is in the bounding rectangle of the specified tool. If the point is in the rectangle, the structure receives information about the tool.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TTHITTESTINFO.hwnd
member.summary: Handle to the tool or window with the specified tool.

member.summary: TOOLINFO structure. If the point specified by pt is in the tool specified by hwnd, this structure receives information about the tool. The cbSize member of this structure must be filled in before sending this message.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage
member.summary: Messages for trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_GETPOS
member.summary: Retrieves the current logical position of the slider in a trackbar. The logical positions are the integer values in the trackbar's range of minimum to maximum slider positions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_GETRANGEMIN
member.summary: Retrieves the minimum position for the slider in a trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_GETRANGEMAX
member.summary: Retrieves the maximum position for the slider in a trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_GETTIC
member.summary: Retrieves the logical position of a tick mark in a trackbar. The logical position can be any of the integer values in the trackbar's range of minimum to maximum slider positions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_SETTIC
member.summary: Sets a tick mark in a trackbar at the specified logical position.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_SETPOS
member.summary: Sets the current logical position of the slider in a trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_SETRANGE
member.summary: Sets the range of minimum and maximum logical positions for the slider in a trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_SETRANGEMIN
member.summary: Sets the minimum logical position for the slider in a trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_SETRANGEMAX
member.summary: Sets the maximum logical position for the slider in a trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_CLEARTICS
member.summary: Removes the current tick marks from a trackbar. This message does not remove the first and last tick marks, which are created automatically by the trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_SETSEL
member.summary: Sets the starting and ending positions for the available selection range in a trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_SETSELSTART
member.summary: Sets the starting logical position of the current selection range in a trackbar. This message is ignored if the trackbar does not have the TBS_ENABLESELRANGE style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_SETSELEND
member.summary: Sets the ending logical position of the current selection range in a trackbar. This message is ignored if the trackbar does not have the TBS_ENABLESELRANGE style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_GETPTICS
member.summary: Retrieves the address of an array that contains the positions of the tick marks for a trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_GETTICPOS
member.summary: Retrieves the current physical position of a tick mark in a trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_GETNUMTICS
member.summary: Retrieves the number of tick marks in a trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_GETSELSTART
member.summary: Retrieves the starting position of the current selection range in a trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_GETSELEND
member.summary: Retrieves the ending position of the current selection range in a trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_CLEARSEL
member.summary: Clears the current selection range in a trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_SETTICFREQ
member.summary: Sets the interval frequency for tick marks in a trackbar. For example, if the frequency is set to two, a tick mark is displayed for every other increment in the trackbar's range. The default setting for the frequency is one; that is, every increment in the range is associated with a tick mark.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_SETPAGESIZE
member.summary: Sets the number of logical positions the trackbar's slider moves in response to keyboard input, such as the or keys, or mouse input, such as clicks in the trackbar's channel. The logical positions are the integer increments in the trackbar's range of minimum to maximum slider positions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_GETPAGESIZE
member.summary: Retrieves the number of logical positions the trackbar's slider moves in response to keyboard input, such as the or keys, or mouse input, such as clicks in the trackbar's channel. The logical positions are the integer increments in the trackbar's range of minimum to maximum slider positions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_SETLINESIZE
member.summary: Sets the number of logical positions the trackbar's slider moves in response to keyboard input from the arrow keys, such as the or keys. The logical positions are the integer increments in the trackbar's range of minimum to maximum slider positions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_GETLINESIZE
member.summary: Retrieves the number of logical positions the trackbar's slider moves in response to keyboard input from the arrow keys, such as the or keys. The logical positions are the integer increments in the trackbar's range of minimum to maximum slider positions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_GETTHUMBRECT
member.summary: Retrieves the size and position of the bounding rectangle for the slider in a trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_GETCHANNELRECT
member.summary: Retrieves the size and position of the bounding rectangle for a trackbar's channel. (The channel is the area over which the slider moves. It contains the highlight when a range is selected.)

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_SETTHUMBLENGTH
member.summary: Sets the length of the slider in a trackbar. This message is ignored if the trackbar does not have the TBS_FIXEDLENGTH style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_GETTHUMBLENGTH
member.summary: Retrieves the length of the slider in a trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_GETTOOLTIPS

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_SETTIPSIDE
member.summary: Positions a tooltip control used by a trackbar control. TrackBar controls that use the TBS_TOOLTIPS style display tooltips.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_SETBUDDY
member.summary: Assigns a window as the buddy window for a trackbar control. TrackBar buddy windows are automatically displayed in a location relative to the control's orientation (horizontal or vertical).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarMessage.TBM_GETBUDDY
member.summary: Retrieves the handle to a trackbar control buddy window at a given location. The specified location is relative to the control's orientation (horizontal or vertical).

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarNotification
member.summary: Notification messages for trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarNotification.TRBN_THUMBPOSCHANGING
member.summary: Notifies that the thumb position on a trackbar is changing. This notification code is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.
member.remarks:
Send this notification to clients that do not listen for WM_HSCROLL or WM_VSCROLL messages.
lPara value
Pointer to a NMTRBTHUMBPOSCHANGING structure. The caller is responsible for allocating this structure and setting its members, including the members of the contained NMHDR structure.
Return value
The return value is ignored.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarScrollNotification
member.summary: A notification code that indicates the user's interaction with the trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarScrollNotification.TB_LINEUP
member.summary: The user pressed the LEFT ARROW (VK_LEFT) or UP ARROW (VK_UP) key.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarScrollNotification.TB_LINEDOWN
member.summary: The user pressed the RIGHT ARROW (VK_RIGHT) or DOWN ARROW (VK_DOWN) key.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarScrollNotification.TB_PAGEUP
member.summary: The user clicked the channel above or to the left of the slider (VK_PRIOR).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarScrollNotification.TB_PAGEDOWN
member.summary: The user clicked the channel below or to the right of the slider (VK_NEXT).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarScrollNotification.TB_THUMBPOSITION
member.summary: The trackbar received WM_LBUTTONUP following a TB_THUMBTRACK notification code.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarScrollNotification.TB_THUMBTRACK
member.summary: The user dragged the slider.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarScrollNotification.TB_TOP
member.summary: The user pressed the HOME key (VK_HOME).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarScrollNotification.TB_BOTTOM
member.summary: The user pressed the END key (VK_END).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarScrollNotification.TB_ENDTRACK
member.summary: The trackbar received WM_KEYUP, meaning that the user released a key that sent a relevant virtual key code.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarStyle
member.summary: The styles used with trackbar controls.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarStyle.TBS_AUTOTICKS
member.summary: The trackbar control has a tick mark for each increment in its range of values.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarStyle.TBS_VERT
member.summary: The trackbar control is oriented vertically.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarStyle.TBS_HORZ
member.summary: The trackbar control is oriented horizontally. This is the default orientation.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarStyle.TBS_TOP
member.summary: The trackbar control displays tick marks above the control. This style is valid only with TBS_HORZ.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarStyle.TBS_BOTTOM
member.summary: The trackbar control displays tick marks below the control. This style is valid only with TBS_HORZ.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarStyle.TBS_LEFT
member.summary: The trackbar control displays tick marks to the left of the control. This style is valid only with TBS_VERT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarStyle.TBS_RIGHT
member.summary: The trackbar control displays tick marks to the right of the control. This style is valid only with TBS_VERT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarStyle.TBS_BOTH
member.summary: The trackbar control displays tick marks on both sides of the control. This will be both top and bottom when used with TBS_HORZ or both left and right if used with TBS_VERT.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarStyle.TBS_NOTICKS
member.summary: The trackbar control does not display any tick marks.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarStyle.TBS_ENABLESELRANGE
member.summary: The trackbar control displays a selection range only. The tick marks at the starting and ending positions of a selection range are displayed as triangles (instead of vertical dashes), and the selection range is highlighted.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarStyle.TBS_FIXEDLENGTH
member.summary: The trackbar control allows the size of the slider to be changed with the TBM_SETTHUMBLENGTH message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarStyle.TBS_NOTHUMB
member.summary: The trackbar control does not display a slider.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarStyle.TBS_TOOLTIPS
member.summary: The trackbar control supports tooltips. When a trackbar control is created using this style, it automatically creates a default tooltip control that displays the slider's current position. You can change where the tooltips are displayed by using the TBM_SETTIPSIDE message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarStyle.TBS_REVERSED
member.summary: This style bit is used for "reversed" trackbars, where a smaller number indicates "higher" and a larger number indicates "lower." It has no effect on the control; it is simply a label that can be checked to determine whether a trackbar is normal or reversed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarStyle.TBS_DOWNISLEFT
member.summary: By default, the trackbar control uses down equal to right and up equal to left. Use the TBS_DOWNISLEFT style to reverse the default, making down equal left and up equal right.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarStyle.TBS_NOTIFYBEFOREMOVE
member.summary: TrackBar should notify parent before repositioning the slider due to user action (enables snapping).

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarStyle.TBS_TRANSPARENTBKGND
member.summary: Background is painted by the parent via the WM_PRINTCLIENT message.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarTipSide
member.summary: Value representing the location at which to display the tooltip control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarTipSide.TBTS_TOP
member.summary: The tooltip control will be positioned above the trackbar. This flag is for use with horizontal trackbars.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarTipSide.TBTS_LEFT
member.summary: The tooltip control will be positioned to the left of the trackbar. This flag is for use with vertical trackbars.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarTipSide.TBTS_BOTTOM
member.summary: The tooltip control will be positioned below the trackbar. This flag is for use with horizontal trackbars.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TrackBarTipSide.TBTS_RIGHT
member.summary: The tooltip control will be positioned to the right of the trackbar. This flag is for use with vertical trackbars.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTRBTHUMBPOSCHANGING
member.summary: Contains information about a trackbar change notification. This message is sent with the TRBN_THUMBPOSCHANGING notification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTRBTHUMBPOSCHANGING.dwPos
member.summary: Position on trackbar.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTRBTHUMBPOSCHANGING.hdr
member.summary: A NMHDR structure that describes the notification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTRBTHUMBPOSCHANGING.nReason
member.summary: Type of movement as one of the following values: TB_LINEUP, TB_LINEDOWN, TB_PAGEUP, TB_PAGEDOWN, TB_THUMBPOSITION, TB_THUMBTRACK, TB_TOP, TB_BOTTOM, or TB_ENDTRACK.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TVCDRF_NOIMAGES
member.summary: TreeView's custom draw return meaning don't draw images. valid on CDRF_NOTIFYITEMPREPAINT

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.PFNTVCOMPARE
member.summary: An application-defined callback function, which is called during a sort operation each time the relative order of two list items needs to be compared.
member.param: Corresponds to the lParam member of the first TVITEM structure for the two items being compared.
Corresponds to the lParam member of the second TVITEM structure for the two items being compared.
Corresponds to the lParam member of this structure.
member.returns: The callback function must return a negative value if the first item should precede the second, a positive value if the first item should follow the second, or zero if the two items are equivalent.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.AsyncDrawRetFlags
member.summary: Action that the sender (the tree-view control) should execute on return.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.AsyncDrawRetFlags.ADRF_DRAWSYNC
member.summary: Proceed to draw the image anyway, that is, synchronously extract the image and paint. Assuming the control is on the UI thread, use of this flag implies low priority UI performance, since extraction times may vary and the UI could be unresponsive for an extended period of time during extraction.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.AsyncDrawRetFlags.ADRF_DRAWNOTHING
member.summary: Do not draw an image.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.AsyncDrawRetFlags.ADRF_DRAWFALLBACK
member.summary: Draw fallback text.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.AsyncDrawRetFlags.ADRF_DRAWIMAGE
member.summary: Draw the image specified by iRetImageIndex.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewActionFlag
member.summary: Specifies the item to retrieve using TVM_GETNEXTITEM or the action for TVM_SELECTITEM.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewActionFlag.TVGN_CARET
member.summary: Retrieves the currently selected item. You can use the TreeView_GetSelection macro to send this message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewActionFlag.TVGN_CHILD
member.summary: Retrieves the first child item of the item specified by the hitem parameter. You can use the TreeView_GetChild macro to send this message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewActionFlag.TVGN_DROPHILITE
member.summary: Retrieves the item that is the target of a drag-and-drop operation. You can use the TreeView_GetDropHilight macro to send this message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewActionFlag.TVGN_FIRSTVISIBLE
member.summary: Retrieves the first item that is visible in the tree-view window. You can use the TreeView_GetFirstVisible macro to send this message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewActionFlag.TVGN_LASTVISIBLE
member.summary: Version 4.71. Retrieves the last expanded item in the tree. This does not retrieve the last item visible in the tree-view window. You can use the TreeView_GetLastVisible macro to send this message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewActionFlag.TVGN_NEXT
member.summary: Retrieves the next sibling item. You can use the TreeView_GetNextSibling macro to send this message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewActionFlag.TVGN_NEXTSELECTED
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Retrieves the next selected item. You can use the TreeView_GetNextSelected macro to send this message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewActionFlag.TVGN_NEXTVISIBLE
member.summary: Retrieves the next visible item that follows the specified item. The specified item must be visible. Use the TVM_GETITEMRECT message to determine whether an item is visible. You can use the TreeView_GetNextVisible macro to send this message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewActionFlag.TVGN_PARENT
member.summary: Retrieves the parent of the specified item. You can use the TreeView_GetParent macro to send this message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewActionFlag.TVGN_PREVIOUS
member.summary: Retrieves the previous sibling item. You can use the TreeView_GetPrevSibling macro to send this message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewActionFlag.TVGN_PREVIOUSVISIBLE
member.summary: Retrieves the first visible item that precedes the specified item. The specified item must be visible. Use the TVM_GETITEMRECT message to determine whether an item is visible. You can use the TreeView_GetPrevVisible macro to send this message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewActionFlag.TVGN_ROOT
member.summary: Retrieves the topmost or very first item of the tree-view control. You can use the TreeView_GetRoot macro to send this message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewActionFlag.TVSI_NOSINGLEEXPAND
member.summary: When a single item is selected, ensures that the treeview does not expand the children of that item. This is valid only if used with the TVGN_CARET flag.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewExpandFlags
member.summary: Action to take when using TVM_EXPAND.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewExpandFlags.TVE_COLLAPSE
member.summary: Collapses the list.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewExpandFlags.TVE_EXPAND
member.summary: Expands the list.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewExpandFlags.TVE_TOGGLE
member.summary: Collapses the list if it is expanded or expands it if it is collapsed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewExpandFlags.TVE_EXPANDPARTIAL
member.summary: Version 4.70. Partially expands the list. In this state the child items are visible and the parent item's plus sign (+), indicating that it can be expanded, is displayed. This flag must be used in combination with the TVE_EXPAND flag.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewExpandFlags.TVE_COLLAPSERESET
member.summary: Collapses the list and removes the child items. The TVIS_EXPANDEDONCE state flag is reset. This flag must be used with the TVE_COLLAPSE flag.

member.summary: Information about the results of a hit test.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewHitTestFlags.TVHT_ONITEMICON
member.summary: On the bitmap associated with an item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewHitTestFlags.TVHT_ONITEMLABEL
member.summary: On the label (string) associated with an item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewHitTestFlags.TVHT_ONITEM
member.summary: On the bitmap or label associated with an item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewHitTestFlags.TVHT_ONITEMINDENT
member.summary: In the indentation associated with an item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewHitTestFlags.TVHT_ONITEMBUTTON
member.summary: On the button associated with an item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewHitTestFlags.TVHT_ONITEMRIGHT
member.summary: In the area to the right of an item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewHitTestFlags.TVHT_ONITEMSTATEICON
member.summary: On the state icon for a tree-view item that is in a user-defined state.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewHitTestFlags.TVHT_ABOVE
member.summary: Above the client area.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewHitTestFlags.TVHT_BELOW
member.summary: Below the client area.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewHitTestFlags.TVHT_TORIGHT
member.summary: To the right of the client area.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewHitTestFlags.TVHT_TOLEFT
member.summary: To the left of the client area.
