member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewItemStates
member.summary: Set of bit flags and image list indexes that indicate the item's state. When setting the state of an item, the stateMask member indicates the valid bits of this member. When retrieving the state of an item, this member returns the current state for the bits indicated in the stateMask member.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewItemStates.TVIS_SELECTED
member.summary: The item is selected. Its appearance depends on whether it has the focus. The item will be drawn using the system colors for selection.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewItemStates.TVIS_CUT
member.summary: The item is selected as part of a cut-and-paste operation.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewItemStates.TVIS_DROPHILITED
member.summary: The item is selected as a drag-and-drop target.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewItemStates.TVIS_BOLD
member.summary: The item is bold.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewItemStates.TVIS_EXPANDED
member.summary: The item's list of child items is currently expanded; that is, the child items are visible. This value applies only to parent items.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewItemStates.TVIS_EXPANDEDONCE
member.summary: The item's list of child items has been expanded at least once. The TVN_ITEMEXPANDING and TVN_ITEMEXPANDED notification codes are not generated for parent items that have this state set in response to a TVM_EXPAND message. Using TVE_COLLAPSE and TVE_COLLAPSERESET with TVM_EXPAND will cause this state to be reset. This value applies only to parent items.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewItemStates.TVIS_EXPANDPARTIAL
member.summary: Version 4.70. A partially expanded tree-view item. In this state, some, but not all, of the child items are visible and the parent item's plus symbol is displayed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewItemStates.TVIS_OVERLAYMASK
member.summary: Mask for the bits used to specify the item's overlay image index.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewItemStates.TVIS_STATEIMAGEMASK
member.summary: Mask for the bits used to specify the item's state image index.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewItemStates.TVIS_USERMASK
member.summary: Same as TVIS_STATEIMAGEMASK.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewItemStates.TVIF_EXPANDEDIMAGE
member.summary: Version 6.00 and Windows Vista. The iExpandedImage member is valid.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewItemStates.TVIF_STATEEX
member.summary: Version 6.00 and Windows Vista. The uStateEx member is valid.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewItemStatesEx
member.summary: Tree view item extended states.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewItemStatesEx.TVIS_EX_FLAT
member.summary: Creates a flat itemthe item is virtual and is not visible in the tree; instead, its children take its place in the tree hierarchy. This state is valid only when adding an item to the tree-view control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewItemStatesEx.TVIS_EX_DISABLED
member.summary: Windows Vista and later. Creates a control that is drawn in gray, that the user cannot interact with.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewItemStatesEx.TVIS_EX_HWND
member.summary: Creates a separate HWND for the item. This state is valid only when adding an item to the tree-view control.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewNotificationReturnBehavior
member.summary: Used as return values to the TVN_SINGLEEXPAND notification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewNotificationReturnBehavior.TVNRET_DEFAULT
member.summary: Allow the default behavior to occur.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewNotificationReturnBehavior.TVNRET_SKIPOLD
member.summary: Skip default processing of the item being unselected.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewNotificationReturnBehavior.TVNRET_SKIPNEW
member.summary: Skip default processing of the item being selected.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewSelChangedCause
member.summary: Used in the action member coming through the lParam of a TVN_SELCHANGED notification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewSelChangedCause.TVC_UNKNOWN
member.summary: Unknown.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewSelChangedCause.TVC_BYMOUSE
member.summary: By a mouse click.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewSelChangedCause.TVC_BYKEYBOARD
member.summary: By a keystroke.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewSetBorderFlags
member.summary: Used as the wParam value in a TVM_SETBORDER message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewSetBorderFlags.TVSBF_XBORDER
member.summary: Applies the specified border size to the left side of the items in the tree-view control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewSetBorderFlags.TVSBF_YBORDER
member.summary: Applies the specified border size to the top of the items in the tree-view control.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewSetImageListType
member.summary: Used as the wParam value in a TVM_SETIMAGELIST and TVM_GETIMAGELIST messages.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewSetImageListType.TVSIL_NORMAL
member.summary: Indicates the normal image list, which contains selected, nonselected, and overlay images for the items of a tree-view control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewSetImageListType.TVSIL_STATE
member.summary: Indicates the state image list. You can use state images to indicate application-defined item states. A state image is displayed to the left of an item's selected or nonselected image.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyle
member.summary: Window styles used when creating tree-view controls.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyle.TVS_CHECKBOXES
member.summary:
Version 4.70. Enables check boxes for items in a tree-view control. A check box is displayed only if an image is associated with the item. When set to this style, the control effectively uses DrawFrameControl to create and set a state image list containing two images. State image 1 is the unchecked box and state image 2 is the checked box. Setting the state image to zero removes the check box altogether. For more information, see Working with state image indexes.
Version 5.80. Displays a check box even if no image is associated with the item.
Once a tree-view control is created with this style, the style cannot be removed. Instead, you must destroy the control and create a new one in its place. Destroying the tree-view control does not destroy the check box state image list. You must destroy it explicitly. Get the handle to the state image list by sending the tree-view control a TVM_GETIMAGELIST message. Then destroy the image list with ImageList_Destroy.
If you want to use this style, you must set the TVS_CHECKBOXES style with SetWindowLong after you create the treeview control, and before you populate the tree. Otherwise, the checkboxes might appear unchecked, depending on timing issues.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyle.TVS_DISABLEDRAGDROP
member.summary: Prevents the tree-view control from sending TVN_BEGINDRAG notification codes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyle.TVS_EDITLABELS
member.summary: Allows the user to edit the labels of tree-view items.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyle.TVS_FULLROWSELECT
member.summary: Version 4.71. Enables full-row selection in the tree view. The entire row of the selected item is highlighted, and clicking anywhere on an item's row causes it to be selected. This style cannot be used in conjunction with the TVS_HASLINES style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyle.TVS_HASBUTTONS
member.summary: Displays plus (+) and minus (-) buttons next to parent items. The user clicks the buttons to expand or collapse a parent item's list of child items. To include buttons with items at the root of the tree view, TVS_LINESATROOT must also be specified.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyle.TVS_HASLINES
member.summary: Uses lines to show the hierarchy of items.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyle.TVS_INFOTIP
member.summary: Version 4.71. Obtains tooltip information by sending the TVN_GETINFOTIP notification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyle.TVS_LINESATROOT
member.summary: Uses lines to link items at the root of the tree-view control. This value is ignored if TVS_HASLINES is not also specified.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyle.TVS_NOHSCROLL
member.summary: Version 5.80. Disables horizontal scrolling in the control. The control will not display any horizontal scroll bars.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyle.TVS_NONEVENHEIGHT
member.summary: Version 4.71 Sets the height of the items to an odd height with the TVM_SETITEMHEIGHT message. By default, the height of items must be an even value.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyle.TVS_NOSCROLL
member.summary: Version 4.71. Disables both horizontal and vertical scrolling in the control. The control will not display any scroll bars.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyle.TVS_NOTOOLTIPS
member.summary: Version 4.70. Disables tooltips.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyle.TVS_RTLREADING
member.summary: Version 4.70. Causes text to be displayed from right-to-left (RTL). Usually, windows display text left-to-right (LTR). Windows can be mirrored to display languages such as Hebrew or Arabic that read RTL. Typically, tree-view text is displayed in the same direction as the text in its parent window. If TVS_RTLREADING is set, tree-view text reads in the opposite direction from the text in the parent window.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyle.TVS_SHOWSELALWAYS
member.summary: Causes a selected item to remain selected when the tree-view control loses focus.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyle.TVS_SINGLEEXPAND
member.summary:
Version 4.71. Causes the item being selected to expand and the item being unselected to collapse upon selection in the tree view. If the mouse is used to single-click the selected item and that item is closed, it will be expanded. If the user holds down the CTRL key while selecting an item, the item being unselected will not be collapsed.
Version 5.80. Causes the item being selected to expand and the item being unselected to collapse upon selection in the tree view. If the user holds down the CTRL key while selecting an item, the item being unselected will not be collapsed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyle.TVS_TRACKSELECT
member.summary: Version 4.70. Enables hot tracking in a tree-view control.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyleEx
member.summary: Extended styles used when creating tree-view controls. The value of extended styles is a bitwise combination of these styles.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyleEx.TVS_EX_AUTOHSCROLL
member.summary: Windows Vista. Remove the horizontal scroll bar and auto-scroll depending on mouse position.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyleEx.TVS_EX_DIMMEDCHECKBOXES
member.summary: Windows Vista. Include dimmed checkbox state if the control has the TVS_CHECKBOXES style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyleEx.TVS_EX_DOUBLEBUFFER
member.summary: Windows Vista. Specifies how the background is erased or filled.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyleEx.TVS_EX_DRAWIMAGEASYNC
member.summary: Windows Vista. Retrieves calendar grid information.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyleEx.TVS_EX_EXCLUSIONCHECKBOXES
member.summary: Windows Vista. Include exclusion checkbox state if the control has the TVS_CHECKBOXES style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyleEx.TVS_EX_FADEINOUTEXPANDOS
member.summary: Windows Vista. Fade expando buttons in or out when the mouse moves away or into a state of hovering over the control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyleEx.TVS_EX_MULTISELECT
member.summary: Not supported. Do not use.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyleEx.TVS_EX_NOINDENTSTATE
member.summary: Windows Vista. Do not indent the tree view for the expando buttons.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyleEx.TVS_EX_NOSINGLECOLLAPSE
member.summary: Windows Vista. Intended for internal use; not recommended for use in applications. Do not collapse the previously selected tree-view item unless it has the same parent as the new selection. This style must be used with the TVS_SINGLEEXPAND style. This style may not be supported in future versions of Comctl32.dll. Also, this style is not defined in commctrl.h.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyleEx.TVS_EX_PARTIALCHECKBOXES
member.summary: Windows Vista. Include partial checkbox state if the control has the TVS_CHECKBOXES style.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TreeViewStyleEx.TVS_EX_RICHTOOLTIP
member.summary: Windows Vista. Allow rich tooltips in the tree view (custom drawn with icon and text).

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTREEVIEW
member.summary: Contains information about a tree-view notification message. This structure is identical to the NM_TREEVIEW structure, but it has been renamed to follow current naming conventions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTREEVIEW.hdr
member.summary: NMHDR structure that contains information about this notification message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTREEVIEW.action
member.summary: Notification-specific action flag. This member is used with the following notification codes: TVN_ITEMEXPANDING, TVN_ITEMEXPANDED, TVN_SELCHANGING, TVN_SELCHANGED. For the possible action flag values, see TVM_EXPAND and TVN_SELCHANGED.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTREEVIEW.itemOld
member.summary: TVITEM structure that contains information about the old item state. This member is zero for notification messages that do not use it.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTREEVIEW.itemNew
member.summary: TVITEM structure that contains information about the new item state. This member is zero for notification messages that do not use it.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTREEVIEW.ptDrag
member.summary: POINT structure that contains the client coordinates of the mouse at the time the event occurred that caused the notification message to be sent.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVASYNCDRAW
member.summary: Contains an explanation of why the draw of an icon or overlay tree item failed. This structure is sent on a TVN_ASYNCDRAW notification. Set the dwRetFlags member to indicate what action the control should take. Note that a draw can fail if there is no image; in other words, when the icon image has not been extracted.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVASYNCDRAW.hdr
member.summary: NMHDR structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVASYNCDRAW.pimldp
member.summary: IMAGELISTDRAWPARAMS structure describing the image that failed to draw.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVASYNCDRAW.hr
member.summary: Result code indicating why the draw failed, either ILDRF_IMAGELOWQUALITY, ILDRF_OVERLAYLOWQUALITY, E_PENDING, or S_OK. A code of S_OK indicates that the image is present but not at the required image quality.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVASYNCDRAW.hItem
member.summary: Handle of the tree item that failed to draw.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVASYNCDRAW.lParam
member.summary: Data for hItem. This is the same data for the item that is retrieved with the message TVM_GETITEM using the appropriate mask in structure TVITEM. This data is parent specific; the parent can store information that helps it identify the tree item or other information. Data is provided in lParam for convenience, so that the parent does not need to send message TVM_GETITEM.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVASYNCDRAW.dwRetFlags
member.summary: Action that the sender (the tree-view control) should execute on return.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVASYNCDRAW.iRetImageIndex
member.summary: Index of the image to draw in the image list. Used if ADRF_DRAWIMAGE is returned in dwRetFlags.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVCUSTOMDRAW
member.summary: Contains information specific to an NM_CUSTOMDRAW (tree view) notification code sent by a tree-view control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVCUSTOMDRAW.nmcd
member.summary: NMCUSTOMDRAW structure that contains general custom draw information.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVCUSTOMDRAW.clrText
member.summary: COLORREF value representing the color that will be used to display text foreground in the tree-view control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVCUSTOMDRAW.clrTextBk
member.summary: COLORREF value representing the color that will be used to display text background in the tree-view control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVCUSTOMDRAW.iLevel
member.summary: Version 4.71. Zero-based level of the item being drawn. The root item is at level zero, a child of the root item is at level one, and so on.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVDISPINFO
member.summary: Contains and receives display information for a tree-view item. This structure is identical to the TV_DISPINFO structure, but it has been renamed to follow current naming conventions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVDISPINFO.hdr
member.summary: NMHDR structure that contains information about this notification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVDISPINFO.item
member.summary: TVITEM structure that identifies and contains information about the tree-view item. The mask member of the TVITEM structure specifies which information is being set or retrieved.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVDISPINFOEX
member.summary: Contains information pertaining to extended TreeView notification information.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVDISPINFOEX.hdr
member.summary: NMHDR structure that contains information about this notification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVDISPINFOEX.item
member.summary: Specifies or receives attributes of a TreeView item.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVGETINFOTIP
member.summary: Contains and receives tree-view item information needed to display a tooltip for an item. This structure is used with the TVN_GETINFOTIP notification code.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVGETINFOTIP.hdr
member.summary: NMHDR structure that contains information about this notification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVGETINFOTIP.pszText
member.summary: Address of a character buffer that contains the text to be displayed. If you want to change the text displayed in the tooltip, you will need to modify the contents of this buffer. The size of this buffer is specified by the cchTextMax structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVGETINFOTIP.cchTextMax
member.summary: Size of the buffer at pszText, in characters. Although you should never assume that this buffer will be of any particular size, the INFOTIPSIZE value can be used for design purposes.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVGETINFOTIP.hItem
member.summary: Tree handle to the item for which the tooltip is being displayed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVGETINFOTIP.lParam
member.summary: Application-defined data associated with the item for which the tooltip is being displayed.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVITEMCHANGE
member.summary: Contains information on a tree-view item change. This structure is sent with the TVN_ITEMCHANGED and TVN_ITEMCHANGING notifications.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVITEMCHANGE.hdr
member.summary: NMHDR structure that contains information about the notification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVITEMCHANGE.uChanged
member.summary: Specifies the attribute. The only supported attribute is state. uChanged must have the following value: TVIF_STATE = The change is the state attribute.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVITEMCHANGE.hItem
member.summary: Handle to the changed tree-view item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVITEMCHANGE.uStateNew
member.summary: Flag that specifies the new item state.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVITEMCHANGE.uStateOld
member.summary: Flag that specifies the item's previous state.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVITEMCHANGE.lParam
member.summary: Reserved for application specific data. For example, a value to associate with the item.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVKEYDOWN
member.summary: Contains information about a keyboard event in a tree-view control. This structure is used with the TVN_KEYDOWN notification code. The structure is identical to the TV_KEYDOWN structure, but it has been renamed to follow current naming conventions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVKEYDOWN.hdr
member.summary: NMHDR structure that contains information about this notification.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVKEYDOWN.wVKey
member.summary: Virtual key code.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.NMTVKEYDOWN.flags
member.summary: Always zero.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TVHITTESTINFO
member.summary: Contains information used to determine the location of a point relative to a tree-view control. This structure is used with the TVM_HITTEST message. The structure is identical to the TV_HITTESTINFO structure, but it has been renamed to follow current naming conventions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TVHITTESTINFO.pt
member.summary: Client coordinates of the point to test.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TVHITTESTINFO.flags
member.summary: Variable that receives information about the results of a hit test.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TVHITTESTINFO.hItem
member.summary: Handle to the item that occupies the point.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TVINSERTSTRUCT
member.summary: Contains information used to add a new item to a tree-view control. This structure is used with the TVM_INSERTITEM message. The structure is identical to the TV_INSERTSTRUCT structure, but it has been renamed to follow current naming conventions.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TVINSERTSTRUCT.hParent
member.summary: Handle to the parent item. If this member is the TVI_ROOT value or NULL, the item is inserted at the root of the tree-view control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TVINSERTSTRUCT.hInsertAfter
member.summary: Handle to the item after which the new item is to be inserted, or one of the following values:

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TVINSERTSTRUCT.itemex
member.summary: Version 4.71. TVITEMEX structure that contains information about the item to add.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TVITEM
member.summary: Specifies or receives attributes of a tree-view item. This structure is identical to the TV_ITEM structure, but it has been renamed to follow current naming conventions. New applications should use this structure.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TVITEM.mask
member.summary: Array of flags that indicate which of the other structure members contain valid data. When this structure is used with the TVM_GETITEM message, the mask member indicates the item attributes to retrieve. If used with the TVM_SETITEM message, the mask indicates the attributes to set.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TVITEM.hItem
member.summary: Handle to the item.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TVITEM.state
member.summary: Set of bit flags and image list indexes that indicate the item's state. When setting the state of an item, the stateMask member indicates the valid bits of this member. When retrieving the state of an item, this member returns the current state for the bits indicated in the stateMask member.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TVITEM.stateMask
member.summary: Bits of the state member that are valid. If you are retrieving an item's state, set the bits of the stateMask member to indicate the bits to be returned in the state member. If you are setting an item's state, set the bits of the stateMask member to indicate the bits of the state member that you want to set. To set or retrieve an item's overlay image index, set the TVIS_OVERLAYMASK bits. To set or retrieve an item's state image index, set the TVIS_STATEIMAGEMASK bits.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TVITEM.pszText
member.summary: Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the item text if the structure specifies item attributes. If this member is the LPSTR_TEXTCALLBACK value, the parent window is responsible for storing the name. In this case, the tree-view control sends the parent window a TVN_GETDISPINFO notification code when it needs the item text for displaying, sorting, or editing and a TVN_SETDISPINFO notification code when the item text changes. If the structure is receiving item attributes, this member is the address of the buffer that receives the item text. Note that although the tree-view control allows any length string to be stored as item text, only the first 260 characters are displayed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TVITEM.cchTextMax
member.summary: Size of the buffer pointed to by the pszText member, in characters. If this structure is being used to set item attributes, this member is ignored.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TVITEM.iImage
member.summary: Index in the tree-view control's image list of the icon image to use when the item is in the nonselected state. If this member is the I_IMAGECALLBACK value, the parent window is responsible for storing the index. In this case, the tree-view control sends the parent a TVN_GETDISPINFO notification code to retrieve the index when it needs to display the image.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TVITEM.iSelectedImage
member.summary: Index in the tree-view control's image list of the icon image to use when the item is in the selected state. If this member is the I_IMAGECALLBACK value, the parent window is responsible for storing the index. In this case, the tree-view control sends the parent a TVN_GETDISPINFO notification code to retrieve the index when it needs to display the image.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.TVITEM.cChildren
member.summary:
Flag that indicates whether the item has associated child items. This member can be one of the following values.
Value Meaning
zero The item has no child items.
one The item has one or more child items.
I_CHILDRENCALLBACK
The parent window keeps track of whether the item has child items.In this case, when the tree-view control needs to display the item, the control sends the parent a TVN_GETDISPINFO notification code to determine whether the item has child items.
If the tree-view control has the TVS_HASBUTTONS style, it uses this member to determine whether to display the button indicating the presence of child items. You can use this member to force the control to display the button even though the item does not have any child items inserted. This allows you to display the button while minimizing the control's memory usage by inserting child items only when the item is visible or expanded.
I_CHILDRENAUTO
Version 6.0 Intended for internal use; not recommended for use in applications.The tree-view control automatically determines whether the item has child items. This flag may not be supported in future versions of Comctl32.dll.Also, this flag is not defined in commctrl.h.Add the following definition to the source files of your application to use the flag:
#define I_CHILDRENAUTO (-2)

member.summary: A value to associate with the item.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.UpDownNotification
member.summary: Notifications for the up-down control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.UpDownNotification.NM_RELEASEDCAPTURE
member.summary: Notifies an up-down control's parent window that the control is releasing mouse capture. This notification is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.UpDownNotification.UDN_DELTAPOS
member.summary: Sent by the operating system to the parent window of an up-down control when the position of the control is about to change.This happens when the user requests a change in the value by pressing the control's up or down arrow. The UDN_DELTAPOS message is sent in the form of a WM_NOTIFY message.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.UpDownStyle
member.summary: Styles for the up-down control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.UpDownStyle.UDS_ALIGNLEFT
member.summary: Positions the up-down control next to the left edge of the buddy window. The buddy window is moved to the right, and its width is decreased to accommodate the width of the up-down control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.UpDownStyle.UDS_ALIGNRIGHT
member.summary: Positions the up-down control next to the right edge of the buddy window. The width of the buddy window is decreased to accommodate the width of the up-down control.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.UpDownStyle.UDS_ARROWKEYS
member.summary: Causes the up-down control to increment and decrement the position when the UP ARROW and DOWN ARROW keys are pressed.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.UpDownStyle.UDS_AUTOBUDDY
member.summary: Automatically selects the previous window in the z-order as the up-down control's buddy window.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.UpDownStyle.UDS_HORZ
member.summary: Causes the up-down control's arrows to point left and right instead of up and down.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.UpDownStyle.UDS_HOTTRACK
member.summary: Causes the control to exhibit "hot tracking" behavior. That is, it highlights the UP ARROW and DOWN ARROW on the control as the pointer passes over them. This style requires Windows 98 or Windows 2000. If the system is running Windows 95 or Windows NT 4.0, the flag is ignored. To check whether hot tracking is enabled, call SystemParametersInfo.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.UpDownStyle.UDS_NOTHOUSANDS
member.summary: Does not insert a thousands separator between every three decimal digits.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.UpDownStyle.UDS_SETBUDDYINT
member.summary: Causes the up-down control to set the text of the buddy window (using the WM_SETTEXT message) when the position changes. The text consists of the position formatted as a decimal or hexadecimal string.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.UpDownStyle.UDS_WRAP
member.summary: Causes the position to "wrap" if it is incremented or decremented beyond the ending or beginning of the range.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.CreateUpDownControl(System.UInt32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.HWND,System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.HINSTANCE,Vanara.PInvoke.HWND,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates an up-down control. Note: This function is obsolete. It is a 16 bit function and cannot handle 32 bit values for range and position.

param.name: dwStyle
param.para: Window styles for the control. This parameter should include the WS_CHILD, WS_BORDER, and WS_VISIBLE styles, and it may include any of the window styles specific to the up-down control.

param.name: x
param.para: Horizontal coordinate, in client coordinates, of the upper-left corner of the control.

param.name: y
param.para: Vertical coordinate, in client coordinates, of the upper-left corner of the control.

param.name: cx
param.para: Width, in pixels, of the up-down control.

param.name: cy
param.para: Height, in pixels, of the up-down control.

param.name: hParent
param.para: Handle to the parent window of the up-down control.

param.name: hInst
param.para: Handle to the module instance of the application creating the up-down control.

param.name: hBuddy
param.para: Handle to the window associated with the up-down control. If this parameter is NULL, the control has no buddy window.

param.name: nUpper
param.para: Upper limit (range) of the up-down control.

param.name: nLower
param.para: Lower limit (range) of the up-down control.

returns.para: Type: HWND
If the function succeeds, the return value is the window handle to the up-down control. If the function fails, the return value is NULL.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.PFNDACOMPARE
member.summary: Defines the prototype for the compare function used by DSA_Sort.

param.name: p1
param.para: A pointer to the first item in the comparison.

param.name: p2
param.para: A pointer to the second item in the comparison.

returns.para: Type: int
The meaning of the return values depends on the function that uses this callback prototype. The return values for DSA_Sort are the following.

listheader.term: If p1 should be sorted ahead of p2.

item.term: If p1 and p2 should be sorted together.
If p1 should be sorted after p2.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.PFNDACOMPARECONST

param.name: p1

param.name: p2
param.para: A pointer to the second item in the comparison.

returns.para: Type: int
The meaning of the return values depends on the function that uses this callback prototype. The return values for DSA_Sort are as follows:

listheader.term: If p1 should be sorted ahead of p2.

item.term: If p1 and p2 should be sorted together.
If p1 should be sorted after p2.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.PFNDAENUMCALLBACK
member.summary: Defines the prototype for the callback function used by dynamic structure array (DSA) and dynamic pointer array (DPA) functions.

param.name: p
param.para: A pointer to the structure to be enumerated.

param.name: pData
param.para: The value that was passed in the pData parameter to function DSA_EnumCallback.

returns.para: Type: int

The return value is used to determine whether to terminate or continue the iteration. A return value of zero indicates that the iteration should stop; nonzero indicates that the iteration should continue.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.PFNDAENUMCALLBACKCONST
member.summary: Defines the prototype for the callback function used by dynamic structure array (DSA) and dynamic pointer array (DPA) functions when the items involved are pointers to constant data.

param.name: p
param.para: A pointer to the constant structure to be enumerated.

param.name: pData
param.para: A value that was passed in the pData parameter to function DSA_EnumCallback or function DPA_EnumCallback.

returns.para: Type: int

The return value is used to determine whether to terminate or continue the iteration. A return value of zero indicates that the iteration should stop; nonzero indicates that the iteration should continue.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.PFNDPAMERGE
member.summary: Defines the prototype for the merge function used by DPA_Merge.

param.name: uMsg
param.para: A message that instructs this function how to handle the merge. One of the following values.

item.term: Perform any additional processing needed when merging pvSrc into pvDest. The function should return a pointer to an item that contains the result of the merge. The value returned by the merge function is stored into the destination, which overwrites the previous value. If the merge function returns NULL, then the merge operation is abandoned.
Perform any additional processing needed when a delete occurs as part of the merge. The function should return NULL.

Perform any user-defined processing when the merge results in an item being inserted as part of the merge. The return value of this function should point to the item result that is inserted as part of the merge. If the merge function returns NULL, then the merge operation is abandoned.

param.name: pvDest
param.para: A pointer to the first item in the merge.

param.name: pvSrc
param.para: A pointer to the second item in the merge.

param.name: lParam
param.para: Additional data that can be used by the merge callback.

member.returns: A pointer to the item which results from the merge or NULL if there is a failure when DPAMM_MERGE or DPAMM_INSERT is used.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.PFNDPAMERGECONST
member.summary: Defines the prototype for the merge function used by DPA_Merge, using constant values.

param.name: uMsg
param.para: A message that instructs this function how to handle the merge. One of the following values.

item.term: Perform any additional processing needed when merging p2 into p1. The function should return a pointer to an item that contains the result of the merge.
Perform any additional processing needed when a delete occurs as part of the merge. The function should return NULL.

Perform any user-defined processing when the merge results in an item being inserted as part of the merge. The return value of this function should point to the item result that is inserted as part of the merge.

param.name: pvDest
param.para: A pointer to the destination item in the merge.

param.name: pvSrc
param.para: A pointer to the source item in the merge.

param.name: lParam
param.para: Additional data that can be used by the merge callback.

returns.para: Type: const void*
A pointer to constant data which results from the merge, or NULL if there is a failure when DPAMM_MERGE or DPAMM_INSERT is used.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.PFNDPASTREAM
member.summary: Defines the prototype for the callback function used by DPA_LoadStream and DPA_SaveStream.

param.name: pinfo
param.para: A pointer to a DPASTREAMINFO structure.

param.name: pstream
param.para: An IStream object to read from or write to.

param.name: pvInstData
param.para: A void pointer to callback data that the client passed to DPA_LoadStream or DPA_SaveStream.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
If this function pointer succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.DPAM
member.summary: Options determining the method used to merge the two arrays. DPAM_NORMAL, DPAM_UNION, and DPAM_UNION are mutually exclusiveonly one of those flags can be set, optionally in conjunction with DPAM_SORTED.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.DPAM.DPAM_SORTED
member.summary: The arrays are presorted; skip sorting. If this flag is not set, the arrays are sorted before they are merged.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.DPAM.DPAM_NORMAL
member.summary: The final array consists of all of the elements originally present in hdpaDest. If any of those elements are also found in hdpaSrc, those elements are merged in the final array. The PFNDPAMERGE callback function is called with the DPAMM_MERGE message. When this flag is set, the final size of the array at hdpaDest is the same as its initial size.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.DPAM.DPAM_UNION
member.summary: The final array is the union of all elements in both arrays. Elements found in both arrays are merged in the final array. Elements found in only one array or the other are added as found. When this flag is set, the PFNDPAMERGE callback function can be called with the DPAMM_MERGE or DPAMM_INSERT message. The final size of the array is at least the size of the larger of hdpaDest and hdpaSrc, and at most the sum of the two.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.DPAM.DPAM_INTERSECT
member.summary: Only elements found in both hdpaSrc and hdpaDest are merged to form the final array. When this flag is set, the PFNDPAMERGE callback function can be called with the DPAMM_MERGE or DPAMM_DELETE message. The final size of the array can range between 0 and the smaller of hdpaDest and hdpaSrc.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.DPAMM
member.summary: A message that instructs this function how to handle the merge.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.DPAMM.DPAMM_MERGE
member.summary: Perform any additional processing needed when merging pvSrc into pvDest. The function should return a pointer to an item that contains the result of the merge. The value returned by the merge function is stored into the destination, which overwrites the previous value. If the merge function returns NULL, then the merge operation is abandoned.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.DPAMM.DPAMM_DELETE
member.summary: Perform any additional processing needed when a delete occurs as part of the merge. The function should return NULL.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.DPAMM.DPAMM_INSERT
member.summary: Perform any user-defined processing when the merge results in an item being inserted as part of the merge. The return value of this function should point to the item result that is inserted as part of the merge. If the merge function returns NULL, then the merge operation is abandoned.

member.name: T:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.DPAS
member.summary: Options for DPA_Search.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.DPAS.DPAS_SORTED
member.summary: Indicates that the DPA is sorted.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.DPAS.DPAS_INSERTBEFORE
member.summary: This value is only valid in conjunction with DPAS_SORTED. If the item is not found, return the position where the item is expected to be found in the sorted DPA.

member.name: F:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.DPAS.DPAS_INSERTAFTER
member.summary: This value is only valid in conjunction with DPAS_SORTED. If the item is not found, return the position where the item is expected to be found in the sorted DPA.

summary.para: [ DPA_Clone is available through Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2). It might be altered or unavailable in subsequent versions.]
Duplicates a dynamic pointer array (DPA).

param.name: hdpaSource
param.para: A handle to an existing DPA to copy.

param.name: hdpaNew
param.para: When NULL, a new array is copied from hdpaSource.
This parameter can also contain an array created with DPA_Create or DPA_CreateEx. The data is overwritten but the original delta size and heap handle retained.

returns.para: Type: HDPA
The handle to the new or altered DPA (hdpaNew) if successful; otherwise, NULL.

summary.para: [ DPA_Create is available for use in the operating systems specified in the Requirements section. It may be altered or unavailable in subsequent versions.]
Creates a dynamic pointer array (DPA).

param.name: cpGrow
param.para: The number of elements by which the array should be expanded, if the DPA needs to be enlarged.

returns.para: Type: HDPA
Returns a handle to a DPA if successful, or NULL if the call fails.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.DPA_CreateEx(System.Int32,Vanara.PInvoke.Kernel32.HHEAP)
member.summary: Creates a dynamic pointer array (DPA) using a given specified size and heap location.

param.name: cpGrow

param.name: hheap
param.para: A handle to the heap where the array is stored.

returns.para: Type: HDPA
Returns a handle to a DPA if successful, or NULL if the call fails.

summary.para: [ DPA_DeleteAllPtrs is available for use in the operating systems specified in the Requirements section. It may be altered or unavailable in subsequent versions.]
Removes all items from a dynamic pointer array (DPA) and shrinks the DPA accordingly.

returns.para: Type: BOOL
Returns TRUE on success or FALSE on failure.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.DPA_DeletePtr(Vanara.PInvoke.HDPA,System.Int32)

summary.para: [ DPA_DeletePtr is available for use in the operating systems specified in the Requirements section. It may be altered or unavailable in subsequent versions.]
Removes an item from a dynamic pointer array (DPA). The DPA shrinks if necessary to accommodate the removed item.

param.para: An index of item to be removed from DPA.

member.returns: Returns the removed item or NULL, if the call fails.

summary.para: [ DPA_Destroy is available for use in the operating systems specified in the Requirements section. It may be altered or unavailable in subsequent versions.]
Frees a Dynamic Pointer Array (DPA).

Returns TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.

member.name: M:Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.DPA_DestroyCallback(Vanara.PInvoke.HDPA,Vanara.PInvoke.ComCtl32.PFNDAENUMCALLBACK,System.IntPtr)

summary.para: [ DPA_DestroyCallback is available for use in the operating systems specified in the Requirements section. It may be altered or unavailable in subsequent versions.]

summary.para: [ DPA_LoadStream is available in Windows Vista. It might be altered or unavailable in subsequent versions. ]
Loads the dynamic pointer array (DPA) from a stream by calling the specified callback function to read each element.

param.name: pfn
param.para: The callback function. See PFNDPASTREAM for the callback function prototype.

param.name: pvInstData
param.para: A pointer to callback data. pvInstData is passed as a parameter to pfn.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns one of the following values.

item.term: Indicates that the callback function was successful and the element was loaded.
Indicates that the callback function was unsuccessful in loading the element; however, the process should continue.
Indicates that one or more of the parameters is invalid.
Indicates that the stream object could not be read.
The buffer length is invalid or there was insufficient memory to complete the operation.

summary.para: [ DPA_Merge is available through Windows XP with Service Pack 2 (SP2). It might be altered or unavailable in subsequent versions.]
Combines the contents of two dynamic pointer arrays (DPAs).

param.name: hdpaDest
param.para: A handle to the first DPA. This array can be optionally presorted. When this function returns, contains the handle to the merged array.

param.name: hdpaSrc
param.para: A handle to the second DPA. This array can be optionally presorted.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Options determining the method used to merge the two arrays. DPAM_NORMAL, DPAM_UNION, and DPAM_UNION are mutually exclusiveonly one of those flags can be set, optionally in conjunction with DPAM_SORTED.

item.term: The arrays are presorted; skip sorting. If this flag is not set, the arrays are sorted before they are merged.

The final array consists of all of the elements originally present in hdpaDest. If any of those elements are also found in hdpaSrc, those elements are merged in the final array. The PFNDPAMERGE callback function is called with the DPAMM_MERGE message. When this flag is set, the final size of the array at hdpaDest is the same as its initial size.

The final array is the union of all elements in both arrays. Elements found in both arrays are merged in the final array. Elements found in only one array or the other are added as found. When this flag is set, the PFNDPAMERGE callback function can be called with the DPAMM_MERGE or DPAMM_INSERT message. The final size of the array is at least the size of the larger of hdpaDest and hdpaSrc, and at most the sum of the two.

Only elements found in both hdpaSrc and hdpaDest are merged to form the final array. When this flag is set, the PFNDPAMERGE callback function can be called with the DPAMM_MERGE or DPAMM_DELETE message. The final size of the array can range between 0 and the smaller of hdpaDest and hdpaSrc.

param.name: pfnCompare
param.para: The PFNDPACOMPARE callback function that compares two elements, one from each DPA, to determine whether they are the same item. If so, the callback function pointed to by pfnCompare is called.

param.name: pfnMerge
param.para: The PFNDPAMERGE callback function that merges the contents when an element is found in both DPAs and is found to be the same item by PFNDPACOMPARE.

param.name: lParam
param.para: Additional parameter used to declare the basis of comparison upon which equality is determined.

returns.para: Type: BOOL
TRUE if successful; otherwise, FALSE.

summary.para: [ DPA_SaveStream is available in Windows Vista. It might be altered or unavailable in subsequent versions. ]
Saves the dynamic pointer array (DPA) to a stream by writing out a header, and then calling the specified callback function to write each element.

param.name: pdpa
param.para: Receives a handle to a DPA.

param.name: pfn
param.para: The callback function. See PFNDPASTREAM for the callback function prototype.

param.name: pvInstData
param.para: A pointer to callback data. pvInstData is passed as a parameter to pfn.

returns.para: Type: HRESULT
Returns one of the following values.

item.term: Indicates that the callback function was unsuccessful in saving the element; however, the process should continue.
Indicates that even though the callback was unsuccessful, the process was uninterrupted.
Indicates that one or more of the parameters is invalid.

summary.para: [ DPA_Search is available for use in the operating systems specified in the Requirements section. It may be altered or unavailable in subsequent versions.]
Finds an item in a dynamic pointer array (DPA).

param.name: iStart
param.para: The index at which to start search.

param.name: pfnCmp
param.para: A comparison function pointer. See PFNDPACOMPARE for the comparison function prototype.

param.name: lParam
param.para: An additional parameter to be passed to pfnCmp.

param.name: options
param.para: This parameter may be one or more of the following.

item.term: Indicates that the DPA is sorted.
This value is only valid in conjunction with DPAS_SORTED. If the item is not found, return the position where the item is expected to be found in the sorted DPA.
This value is only valid in conjunction with DPAS_SORTED. If the item is not found, return the position where the item is expected to be found in the sorted DPA.

returns.para: Type: int
Returns the index where the item was found in the DPA or if the item was not found.
